text:
Something clearly went wrong here, must have been a bad batch or bottle.
Terrible aroma of ketchup and herbal ointment.
More ketchup in flavor. Very bad.

From can (San Diego) in porter glass. Pours black with 1 finger tan head and aroma of mocha and ground coffee. Rich, well-rounded taste with coffee bitterness in the finish. Had it in the morning because it felt like I should!
W zapachu mnÃ³stwo kawy i czekolady, piana szybko opadajÄ…ca. W smaku rÃ³wnieÅ¼ duÅ¼o kawy i subtelnej palonoÅ›ci. Bardzo wytrawne, odrobinÄ™ wodniste. Bardzo dobry, ale spodziewaÅ‚em siÄ™ wiÄ™cej.

I really enjoyed the very dark black colour of this beer. The intentsive coffee taste makes the beer too bitter for me - almost like real coffee (I am not going to repeat rest of the usual description of taste that comes with this kind of imperial stouts. It is already done very well by others).

Considering that I prefer more sweet-like imperial stouts, it is not my very favourite imperial stout. Of course, it is not bad - specially if one enjoys the bitter coffe taste - and I would recommend it to everyone, who enjoys really good stout, but for me, this beer lacks spirit - just thick coffee tasted imp stout isnÂ’t it. But, of course, as we Estonians say - we do not argue about the taste, we fight about it.

Black color, medium sized brown head. Aromas of coffee, roasted malt, light chocolate, caramel, oats and sweet licorice. Taste of freshly grinded coffee beans, roasted malt, chocolate, hops and a hint of cinnamon. Dry and roasted finish.

Copenhagen 5/6 2017. 33 cl bottle from little delishop on Gammel Kongevej. A little coffee presentation the label with beans, a coffee maker and a mug of coffee. Very explosive upon opening. Pours almost solid beige foam at first. Settles as solid black fluid with 0,5 cm thick layer of beige foam. Heavy Lacing. Aroma is rich and intense. Coffee, licorice, caramel anm more coffee. Of the bitter and strong variety. Soft carbonation and creamy soft palate. Flavor is heavy sweet and rich. Followed by medium coffee bitterness. Aftertaste is medium bitter. A nice coffee bomb. If I should choose to drink beer to my breakfast this would certainly be a contender.

Bottle @ Warwick University Real Ale Festival 2017. Smells and tastes nice and rich, although the beer feels almost a little too thick and oily on the palate. ItÂ’s a nice beer, although I was left wondering exactly what warranted the Â’Best Stout in the WorldÂ’ tag, if IÂ’m honest.

W aromacie lekka palonosc i duÅ¼o duÅ¼o duÅ¼o kawy i czekolady. Piana doÅ›Ä‡ szybko opada, ale wyglÄ…d super. GÄ™ste, piwo oblepia szkÅ‚o na maxa. Czarne jak smoÅ‚a. W smaku bardzo intensywna kawa, espresso, wytrawne, maÅ‚o sÅ‚odyczy, goryczka niska w kierunku Å›redniej. Mniej czekolady niz w Aromacie ale jest. Wysycenie niskie. Wszystko jest mocno skoncentrowane, jednak jest lekka wodnistoÅ›Ä‡. To psuje trochÄ™ odbiÃ³r. Poza tym zajebiste.

Black color. Thin brown head that receeds quickly into a pencil thin ring. Aroma is coffee, chilis, smoke and hickory bbq sauce. Thin body. Taste green chilis, bitter coffee, tobacco and chocolate. Finishes long and smokey. There seems to be a peppery feel without the spice. Decent beer but if i recall the beer geek brunch was better.

Bottle 330ml. Pours black with ruby reflections. Beige head. I appreciate a lot when coffee stouts have no this awful sour note (neither in nose nor mouth). Coffee and coffee and maybe coffee in aroma. Nuts. Oily, dense, delicate ash in terms of consistency. I expected it to be a bit sweeter (I associate Danish breakfast with coffee and sweetness), white itÂ’s actually quite dry. Aftertaste of cereal coffee and quite a roastiness. Delicately tastes as if it was smoked. Chapeau bas to Mikkeller they are somehow able to brew one of their flagship beers in a quantity allowing for providing easy availibility all over the world.
Yum. From tap, nearly black, foamy brown head, fades to crema collar. Nice coffee aroma, coffee flavors with chicory, bitter chocolate, earth. Long bone dry finish, really nice.

W aromacie na pierwszym planie kawa, palone w taki ogniskowy sposob, zbozowe. Barwa prawie czarna, piana skapa, utrzymujaca siÄ™. W smaku jest ta sama palonosc, kawa zbozowa. Palonosc jest niska, jest troche wodniste, brakuje mu ciala, wytrawne. Goryczka niska troche, brakuje jej. Fajny stout, ale tylko fajny, nie urywa dupy.

Dark body with orange-y head.
Nose on the coffee then green-ish fruity notes, herbs.
Moderate attack with pleasant thin bubbles.
Medium body quite fine and not dry.
Finish is a bit fruity, on herbs and a bit dry.
When oxydizing thereÂ’s a bit of a liquorous vibe appearing.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Firstly, it looks fantastic, the darkest beer I have ever seen, with decent foam. Roasted coffee. And it have a hard bitterness at the aftertaste. Its a very good Stout.

Samo piwo ma ciemny kolor, prawie czarny. Spora piana. W aromacie jest trochÄ™ sÅ‚odko z lekko kwaÅ›nym finiszem. LiczyÅ‚em na wiÄ™cej. BiorÄ™ pierwszego Å‚yka, biorÄ™ drugiego Å‚yka i mam wraÅ¼enie, Å¼e czujÄ™ kawÄ™ a nie piwo. Na pierwszym planie jest duÅ¼o gorzkiej czekolady, bardzo duÅ¼o. OprÃ³cz tego spory kwaÅ›ny finisz. Piwo jest gÅ‚adkie, nagazowanie jest bliskie zeru. CiaÅ‚o nie jet zbyt gÄ™ste, ale przez konkretny smak wydaje siÄ™ byÄ‡ bardzo peÅ‚ne.Kawa, kawa i jeszcze raz kawa.

Pours black in color with tan head. Quite roasty aroma with and oat like edge. Smooth, with a burnt coffee character and bitter chocolate finish. Thin bodied. 

Notes: on tap at a Mikkeller event at Tenaya Creek Brewing (May Â’17)

Have had multiple variations of this brew over the years but never rated the original. Needs to warm up to be best appreciated. Cold coffee. Espresso. Dark roasted malts. Feels glossier than other variations. Still good stuff. Drives mute though.

Drinked in a 6 month old bottle. Nose, oat, coffee beans and tipical centennial hop notes. In mouth is full bodied, personally, much better than how seems at the nose. Is rich, balanced and with a long and enjoyable palate. A pleasant coffee bitterness mixed with a malty sweetness and a floral hop fantasy.

Aromat: mocny,przyjemny, mnÃ³stwo czekolady i jeszcze wiÄ™cej kawy .
WyglÄ…d: ciemnobrÄ…zowe, beÅ¼owa pianka, raczej niewielka, szybko redukuje siÄ™ do obwÃ³dki na szkle.
Smak: Super kawowe, czuÄ‡ Å›wietnÄ…, wysokiej jakoÅ›ci kawÄ™, chyba najlepiej uÅ¼yta kawa w piwie, z tych jakie piÅ‚em do tej pory. WaÅ¼ne Å¼e mimo swej intensywnoÅ›ci ta kawa nie jest mÄ™czÄ…ca. DuÅ¼o gorzkiej czekolady dajÄ…cej fajnÄ… sÅ‚odycz, trochÄ™ palonego jÄ™czmienia, goryczka spora, w sam raz pasujÄ…ca do tego piwa, a skÅ‚adajÄ…ca siÄ™ z kawy, palonego jÄ™czmienia i chmielu-Å¼ywiczne akcenty. Wytrawne, nie mÄ™czy tutaj Å¼adna zbÄ™dna sÅ‚odycz Bardzo gÅ‚adkie i aksamitne przez pÅ‚atki owsiane, ale ani przez moment nie miaÅ‚em odczucia braku ciaÅ‚a. Goryczka chwilkÄ™ zalega, finisz lekko kwaskowy od kawy. Piwo bardzo bogate i Å›wietnie zbalansowane. Bardzo dobre, najlepsze piwo z kawÄ… jakie dotÄ…d piÅ‚em, kaÅ¼dy Å‚yk sprawia wielkÄ… przyjemnoÅ›Ä‡. Åšwietne
Thick iced coffee in a swirling dark pool. Tan bubbles rise. Caffeinated taste. How you like your eggs in the morning? Mikkeller.

On tap at Frisco Taphouse and Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Opaque, dark brown with a brown head very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, roasted coffee, chocolate and dark dried fruit. 

Taste of roasted malt, dried dark fruit with a slightly tart edge, roasted coffee, oatmeal and slightly bitter cocoa. The flavor is best when you let it linger on your tongue. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation. Feels great in the mouth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black colour, two fingers brown head that fades to a thin layer, good lace. Aroma of chocolate coffee, dark and dried fuits, raisins. Full, creamy and oily palate, good carbonation. Taste of coffee, chocolate, raisins, licorice.

Pours an oily black with a finger of tan, thick, bubbly head. Very roast aroma, lots of malts and coffee. Very roasty, rich Russian Imperial stout-ish malt character in the taste, with some present but subtle coffee. ItÂ’s definitely different than the coffee bomb that is your standard coffee stout. Finishes with a pleasant bitterness. Thick, velvety mouthfeel. Delicious.
Aroma of cofee.taste dominated by cold cofee,faint cocoa,dark cocolate.complex,smooth,big body,hard to drink beer.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupeÅ‚niania profilu na ratebeer. Czarna barwa, piÄ™kna piana. Intensywne aromaty kawy i gorzkiej czekolady. Kremowe, intensywnie palone i goryczkowe, z fajnÄ…, czekoladowÄ… sÅ‚odyczÄ…. Klasyk.

Very nice stout. Maybe not the thing that it is made into, but very nice stout just the same. Nice hint of coffee flavour and very sweet and melty to the tongue. IÂ’m not a great stout lover, but this one is certainly among the best IÂ’ve tasted.

330 ml bottle bought at IC Beer in Kwun Tong.
Looks: Opaque deep blackish brown colour with a faint trace of yeast sediments; Near zero head with residual soapy beige foam which fades in 10 seconds; Poor sticky lacing with zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant dark malt, with strong roastyness, strong blackcurrant, raisins, plums, strong caramel, sticky toffee, dark chocolates, coffee, rich cream, floral, sugar, spices, liquorices, bread, light lemon and grass. Layered and nice!

Taste: Close to medium sweet rich dark malt, with very strong roastyness, very strong tartness, strong burnt toast, strong ash, light caramel, toffee, Cola, light raisins, muted dark fruits, strong black coffee, strong dark chocolates, floral, sugar, strong spices, strong earth, biscuits, light yeast, strong lemon, strong bitter hops and sharp grass. Wow!

Body: Medium body; Oily and smooth palate.

Mouth Feel: Rich dark maltyness in a thick background. Viscous yet slightly watery. Very roasty from the get go with big tartness IÂ’ve ever tasted for the style, intricately linked with dynamic black coffee and burnt toast, which work so damn well I though this is a freshly grinded iced black coffee! Some decent dark fruit background, ashy with bitter dark chocolate with matching floral and medium sweetness. Spicy biscuity with strong lemon to round. Big and nice!

Hoppiness: Floral, spices, light lemon and grass in nose, Strong spices, earth, floral, strong lemon and sharp grass in taste; Bitterness - hops and burnt malt - is very strong for a lasting, very high astringent bitter-sweet dark malty finish.

After taste: Quite dry. Tart, roasty and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: ItÂ’s aroma is nice and delicate with dark berries and cream, but nothing prepares me for the whirlwind of hard hitting taste - burnt toast, ashy tartness, dark fruits, strong black coffee and lemony hops. This is Guinness FES with a strong punch. Complex and mind blasting, highly recommended!
Flot mÃ¸rk stout med blÃ¸dheden fra havren. Espressokaffe noter og malt. Virkelig god Ã¸l.

650 ml bottle from Canada Craft Club. Pours a nearly black colour with moderate-sized, creamy mocha-coloured head. Aroma is quite smoky with coffee, dark chocolate and a mellow citric character. Flavour is big and roasty, verging on smoky with coffee, dark chocolate, licorice and citric hops. Big body. Impressive.
Pours pitch black, minimal head. from bottle - cococa. from glass - coffee, oatmeal, cocoa, spices, roasty. High bitterness, medium sourness. medium body, creamy, lively, bitter finish.
W aromacie kawa, palone sÅ‚ody i owsiane ciastka. W smaku gorzka czekolada, kawa, taka delikatnie kwaskowa, trochÄ™ odczucie jakby siÄ™ piÅ‚o naprawdÄ™ dobrÄ…, tylko zimnÄ… kawÄ™ przy tym piwie.

Proefglas van 33cl-fles tijdens HOP goes Black in Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Zwart met een dunne bruine schuimkraag. G: Floraal, licht koffie, een beetje chocolade en zoethout. S: Zoet met een moutbittere afdronk. Floraal, wat chocolade en koffie. Droge afdronk. M: Volmondig, licht sticky en lichte carbonatie.

12 ounces bottle from private import. Aroma: coffee, oatmeal, anise, licorice slightly smokey. App: pitch black with small brown head leaving big bubbly lacing. Taste and palate: good chocolate taste. Medium body, light to medium sweetness, mouthfeel is almost fluffy, light smokey bitter finish. Overall: hum. Maybe because I have a sore throat and that IÂ’m feeling a bit under the weather but was expecting so much more from this beer. I enjoyed the taste and also the mouthfeel but thought the nose was too focused on the anise. IÂ’ll try another bottle when IÂ’m not feeling sick. IÂ’m sure IÂ’ll like it better.

NaprawdÄ™ dobry stout, ale czy najlepszy? WyglÄ…da Å›wietnie - gÄ™sta,trwaÅ‚a piana i czarna barwa. Smak i aromat oczywiÅ›cie zdominowane przez kawÄ™ - i to nie kawÄ™ byle jakÄ…. Do tego trochÄ™ palonoÅ›ci, nut kawy zboÅ¼owej. Raczej wytrawny profil. CaÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡ intensywna. NaprawdÄ™ nieÅºle, ale chyba oczekiwaÅ‚em wiÄ™cej.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of coffee, burnt malts, chocolate and cream. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter. Lovely roasty flavour. Motor oil mouthfeel. Lovely stuff.

Czekolada, kawa, pralinki, lekki kokos, palonoÅ›Ä‡, ciemne sÅ‚ody, ciastka owsiane, w tle majaczy nuta wÄ™dzona - tak wÅ‚aÅ›nie pachnie Beer Geek breakfast. Mocno, mocno wyczuwalna kawa, dajaca wrÄ™cz po kilku Å‚ykach posmak asfaltowy, WyraÅºna palonoÅ›Ä‡, goryczka. Gorzka czekolada, caÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡ wytrawna. Mega dÅ‚ugi finisz, posmak bardzo gorzkiej czekolady. Bardzo gÅ‚adkie. Konkret!

Muy buena stout con una hermosa crema dorada parda como la del buen cafe q no perdura en exceso pero muy agradable. De gran aroma y con mucha intensid s. De sabosr intwnso con una agradable amargor yacidez final q perdura en boca. De gran fuerza por suno demasiada graduacion perfecta para arrancar de maÃ±ana en el desayuno, jeje. El sabor a cafe es intenso y muy agradable a torrefacto. Cerveza mas q recomendable

Piwo jest czarne, zupeÅ‚nie nieprzejrzyste.
Piana doÅ›Ä‡ duÅ¼a, kremowa, drobna, beÅ¼owa z czasem redukujÄ…ca siÄ™ do pierÅ›cienia na powierzchni, pozostawia, Å‚adny, trwaÅ‚y lacing.

PijalnoÅ›Ä‡ wysoka, stout sam w krÃ³tkim odstÄ™pie czasu znika ze szkÅ‚a.
Tap at Mikkeller Opening, Berlin - dark black color with big brown head. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, dark malts. medium sweet, well balanced. great stout.

Visual: (cellared for 2 years). Old label prior to 2017. Pours jet black with just a bit of bubbles, thin ringed retention. Some barely visible bubbles surfacing.

Nose: roasted liquid barley and roasted coffee mix, hints of alcohol. Fairly clean. (lvl-8)-pungency

Attack: slightly thicker-light crisp, oily roasted coffee impression

Mid-palate: clean deep roast coffee, background subdued coffee sour-fruity note, (lvl-4-sweetness), sweet roasted barley

Finish: pleasant roasted bittersweet coffee exhale, off-dry dark chocolate

Summary: All around super clean and virtually no alcohol detection Â– ABV just right. Wickedly sippable with balanced bittersweet roasted coffee and barley notes. This makes me want to try the other BGB variants.

Czarne z Å‚adnÄ…, brÄ…zowÄ…, chociaÅ¼ niezbyt trwaÅ‚Ä… pianÄ… ktÃ³ra jednak zdobi szkÅ‚o. W aromacie dominuje ciemne pieczywo, dalej palonoÅ›Ä‡ i kawa ktÃ³ra nie byÅ‚a w moim odczuciu dominujÄ…ca, raczej wkomponowana w caÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡. W tle suszone Å›liwki. Nie jest zbyt sÅ‚odkie, bardzo przyjemne tekstura, aksamitne.
22 oz. bottle. Pour was black with a tan head. Aroma of sweet coffee, licorice, chocolate. Tastes was bittersweet, coffee, roasted malts, licorice, espresso. Nice.
This is a really good stout with a sharp slightly bitter coffee aftertaste. It pours as black as night with an espresso foam-like head. Very rich.
somehow tastes like ceylon tea with sugar. Not bitter, light taste of oatmeal, too sweet for me.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 Aromat: Sporo kawy oraz palonych nut. W tle jest jeszcze trochÄ™ mlecznej czekolady, pÅ‚atkÃ³w owsianych oraz czerwonych owocÃ³w, ale to kawa gra gÅ‚Ã³wnÄ… rolÄ™.

Goryczka jest doÅ›Ä‡ wysoka, palono-kawowa. Niskie wysycenie, dobrze ukryty alkohol oraz sÅ‚Ã³d owsiany zapewniajÄ… wysokÄ… pijalnoÅ›Ä‡ oraz aksamitnoÅ›Ä‡ piwa.

Pretty much a pitch black beer with a coffee like head.

Aroma: roasted malts, oats, some chocolate and walnuts

Taste: roasted malts, coffee, chocolate some walnuts and ligt bitterness at the end.

Pours pitch black with a fizzy brown head, some lacing. Aroma is strong coffee and roasted malts. Taste is strong on coffee too, roasted malts, burnt caramel, a bit tart with a very bitter finish, totally sugarless. Enjoyable if you like coffee and you donÂ’t mind the evil bitterness of the after taste. I donÂ’t. Good stout, very rich.

11.2oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a large brown head. Aroma is coffee and oats with some roast and chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate, roast, oats, and a little toast. Sweet with a bitter, roasty finish. Lingering coffee. Very light alcohol. Medium body. Low carbonation. Smooth, slick, creamy mouthfeel that could stand to be a little thicker.

Zwart bier met dunne bruine schuimkraag. Geur: geroosterde mout, koffie, noten, chocolade. Smaak: geroosterde mout, geroosterde noten, koffie, donkere bittere chocolade en een lichte zoetigheid. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Medium volmondig. Afdronk: lang, droog, licht bitter, geroosterde noten.

Ciemny kolor, Å‚adna piana. W zapachu bardzo kawowy, duÅ¼o palonoÅ›ci. Smak podobnie - mocna kawa, lekka kawowa kwasowoÅ›Ä‡, spora i dÅ‚uga palona goryczka. Po lekkim ogrzaniu wychodzÄ… delikatniejsze, czekoladowe nuty, ale sÅ‚odyczy nie ma prawie wcale. Niskie wysycenie, aksamitne odczucie w ustach. Dobre.
Flavors: roast and coffee (smells like it tastes). Low carbonation, smooth, nice lacing. Some caramel, plums and chocolate in the mouth. Great!

330ml bottle. Pours black with large beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate. Medium body with soft carbonation. Taste is nicely balanced medium bitter, medium sweet with light bittersweet finish and long sweet coffee aftertaste.

W aromacie ziarna kawy, Å›wieÅ¼o zmielona kawa, nieco czekolady i laktoza. W wyglÄ…dzie czarne z obrÄ…czkÄ… beÅ¼owej piany. W smaku mocna kawa, ziarna kawy, gorzkie kakao, deserowa czekolada. Pijalne, sÅ‚odkawe z palonÄ… goryczkÄ…, bardzo wyraziste. Piwo o wybitnie kawowym charakterze, smaczne i konkretne.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Bottle, pours pitch black with high and pillowy beige head. Aroma of fresh roasted coffee, chocolate and dark fruits. In taste light sweetness and a long but not overhelming bitter finish from roasted malts. Medium bodied and smooth. Alcohol is very well hidden.
Densa, cremosa y muy cafetosa! En nariz torrefacta, aroma a cafÃ© molido; en boca tambiÃ©n presente. Con final amargo y seco.
Rich coffee, hints of milk chocolate, creamy oats, caramel medium sweetness, medium coffee bitterness, smooth body.

Bottle 0,33. Pours black with medium creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, cocoa, coffee. Somewhat bitter taste with notes coffee dark chocolate, roasted malts. Long aftertaste of bitter chocolate. Medium body and soft carbonation.

Po chwili dochodzi trochÄ™ sÅ‚odyczy, kojarzÄ…cej siÄ™ z jakimÅ› Å›wieÅ¼ym owocem, nie ma tu mowy o utlenieniu, czekolada deserowa, jakby trochÄ™ drewna. Draft Half Pint at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London in Nov 2010 - Pitch Black in colour. Very strong powerful roast espresso coffee aroma and flavour. Very Malty; roasty/burnt malts, oaty, dark espresso coffee, dark bitter chocolate, caramel, vanilla. Rich, dense. Creamy smooth full-bodied. Well balanced. Alcohol well disguised. Mega coffee roast malty throughout. Very long dry roast finish. Slightly bitter. Stunning beer! (2010-11)

Bottle at home. Pours jet black with a thin dirty tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, toffee and a little smoke. Taste is a chocolate, coffee boozy mix, the booze only shows a hint of the warmth, nice lingering coffee and chocolate taste. Really nice

This beer is awesome. I loved the creamy oatiness on the tongue. There coffee choice kills it and makes for a nice breakfast drink. DidnÂ’t realize it was 7.5% until I started this review. You definitely donÂ’t taste that high a %. Well done.

mocno czuÄ‡ kawÄ™, palonoÅ›Ä‡, gorzka czekolada, w smaku Å›rednie ciaÅ‚o, duÅ¼o kwaÅ›noÅ›ci od kawy, trochÄ™ czuÄ‡ teÅ¼ peÅ‚noÅ›Ä‡i gorzkiej czekolady, posmak jest dosyc dziwny, coÅ› w stylu wÄ™dzonego nawet, nie typowo palonego, fajne piwo, pomimo, Å¼e ktÃ³ryÅ› juÅ¼ raz jÄ… pije

Bottle shared at home. Black with light tan head. Sweet roasted chocmalts, charcoal, roasted nuts, old coffee. Light sweet and quite ashy bitter and light woody sour. Medium body, bit thin feel but quite a roasted aroma to make up for it. Quite nice, bitter dark choco and charcoal finish.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Black with good sized light brown head. Quite some roasted notes, coffee, light dust, chestnuts, dried berries, a hint of cream. Under medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied with a bit watery finish. Nice coffee stout.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, molasses, mocha, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, molasses and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. This is by far the most complete stout there is. It has everything; malts, caramel, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee; and even hops. All the Â’flawsÂ’ I can think of have to do with the abv. Ohh to even think about writing them down. It could have been intenser and with more intensity, complexity and balance matter even more. Strange to imagine this is the highest rating I can give for this style and even stranger to imagine that there might be something better out there.

500ml bottle from Bistro lÂ’Autre Oeil. Pours a very minimal amount of head and pretty much disappears immediately. Has a pitch black coloured appearance. Lacing is weak. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, cocoa, hints of raisins, resin hops. Flavours are a grab bag of sweets, cocoa, chocolate, coffee and much more. Some notes earthy and resin hops. Great retention. Overall was pretty good but maybe it was left aside for quite a while.

De geur is zoals een typische stout. Donkere schuimkraag, heel zwarte kleur. De smaak is nog slechter dan een typische stout, er zit een rare nasmaak aan. Geen aanrader of je moet een stoutliefhebber zijn en dan nog.

Gedronken met Peter, weinig schuim, maar duidelijke smaak, koffie, vanillie, gebrand proef ik erg, niet mijn smaak, maar erg duidelijke smaken komen naar voren daarom vind ik dit bier goed gelukt en in zijn stijl super.
0.33l bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and vanilla. A slightly sour edge and a little spice, although that could be the Thai food from earlier. Dry bitter finish.
Zwarte kleur, mooie mokka kleurige kraag. Ruikt geroosterd, koffie. Smaak is ook zo, bitter zoet, vleugje romig.
Opaque black color with a whispy light down head. Very smooth mouthfeel from the heavy oatmeal bill. Smooth and robust dark roast coffee. It begs for bacon and pancakes.
Bottle from Importe de Biere in Strasbourg. Deep black. Nose is toast, citrus. Palate is dominated by the toast malts, coffee , some toffee. Good! A bit too sweet and toasty.

11.2 oz single, bottled at Lervig and purchased at Mile High Wine & Spirits (BF 09/09/20). Black appearance with a light brown head. Aroma of gourmet coffee, roasted grain and chocolate malt, with hints of licorice, caramel, earth and brown sugar. Similar flavor, rich and moderately bitter, balanced by a mild malt sweetness. Medium body with a smooth, creamy feel and a lingering, light dry finish. A delicious classic, one of the best straight up stouts out there.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A shining black beer with a medium beige foamy head ; good retention. Roast, toast, coffee, light black chocolate, light herb, light fruity note. Medium dry lasting bitter refreshing, sweet note. Medium good body, light to medium texture, soft carbonation, toasty bitter coffee average lasting finish. Overall, very good !

Bomber. Nice roasty aroma, a little sweet. Jet black color, dark tan head that lingers nicely, average lacing. Initially detect the bitterness from the coffee, nice chocolate undertones. Med to full bodied, lively carbonation. Overall, a very nice oatmeal stout!

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2016 Puur zwart bier met dikke mokkakleurige schuimkraag die langzaam inzakt. Aroma en smaken van koffie, vanille, chocolade. Vol en zeer romig van smaak door de havermout. Licht bittere chocolade afdronk waar je wel even geniet van hebt. Blijft goed aan het tandvlees plakken. Slechts 7,5 % maar smaak voor 10. Topbier !!

Dark brown with a small brown foamy head. Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, liqourice, caramel. Sweet with some roasted bitterness in the aftertaste. One of the most well balanced and smooth stouts I have tasted.

A very complex stout.You can feel the silkyness of the oats and taste coffee,chocolate,roasted malts.It is fairly bitter but mostly by the grains.Some acidity is present but mostly the burnt and smokey sensation of the grains is strong but not overwhelming...definitely not for breakfast in my country!

TAP. Black pour with minimal tan head.. 
Coffee & subdued black malt nose..
Easy dark malt body, oatmeal softens the darkness, coffee kick at back end.. sourced mikkeller San Diego

330 mL bottle. The pour is a nice dark black with at thick darker khaki head and a heavy soapy lace as it falls down to a thin film. The aroma is really roasty and chocolate heavy with a light alcohol and a good bit of licorice. There is a hint of sweetness in there, but for the most part this is roasted malt and chocolate. The flavor is big and roasty with a hefty malt and chocolate and a light alcohol. There is a sweet lactose and a light bitter licorice also joining in there. The mouth feel is a little light with a slightly brighter carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and heavy licorice and roasty chocolate. Interesting beer, but itÂ’s not as great as I would like to have it.
330ml bottle. Aroma has liquirice and coffee. Taste is rosted malt with hints of coffee. Very smoorh and delicious!

Birra che mi ha abbastanza deluso. Sentore predominante di caffÃ¨ bruciato, che rende la birra abbastanza secca e amara, ma coprendo altri sapori. Riscaldandosi, si modera un poÂ’ lÂ’asprezza del tostato e emerge qualche altro sentore, ma poca roba.

Black. Rich malt, roasted barley, coffee, and some additional chocolate and spice in the aroma. Balanced sweetness with a dry and fairly bitter finish. Full body and a soft and creamy texture. Overall, a great stout. Personally I would like it to be just a tad sweeter, but it is still very tasty.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Pikzwart. Neus koffiebonen. De smaak, koffiebonen gebrand met bittere chocolade. Stroperig en dik.

Pours a dark brown/black color with a thin, quickly dissipating tan head. Nose is intense roasted coffee and cocoa. Flavour follows the aroma - acidic coffee beans with undertones of cocoa and burnt toast. Thick, oily texture, low carbonation, bitter finish. Good, but not outstanding.

Brilliant beer. Completely black, with an almost oily texture. Aroma is incredibly intense and complex, with lots of aromas, especially coffee and some chocolate. Flavour is similar. Very intense coffee (espresso) flavour. Long tasty and creamy finish.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Direktlieferung von Mikkeller). Ein Bier, wie Eiskaffee im Adlon.
Black with a dark brown head. Aroma is strong coffee, chocolate, and undertone of oatmeal. Taste is coffee, bitter chocolate, and aftertaste of oatmeal.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2017 Bottle. Pitch black beer, small tan head. Aroma of coffee, cocoa, milk chocolate and resin in background. Complex and intense taste: light coffee sourness, light chocolate sweetness, medium bitterness, mostly coffee, coffee beans, bitter chocolate. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Long roasted coffee aftertaste. Great take on the style, easily drinkable and really tasty stout.

Intense, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, dry, slightly charred cocoa beans. Black, small, creamy, beige head. Medium bitter. More dark filter coffee, light acidic, bitterness intensifies, dark chocolate, dry, yet almost a touch watery in texture, soft carbonation, flat carbonation, full bodied, dry and bitter finish full of coffee flavours. Nice Stout, great coffee and chocolate, yet maybe not quite living up to the hype. Keg at Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.

On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a nice dry smooth sessionable feel to it. Carbonation feels fine.
Overall, good imperial stout that I would have again, preferably before the coffee bean acidity slides in....hmmmm. This bottle was dated best before 07/09/20, double hmmmm....

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2017 330ml bottle. Pours pitch black. Aroma is all bitter dark chocolate and coffee with plenty of savoury oats and a hint of umami and smoke. Flavour starts all coffee, like what I imagine really good coffee tastes like. Bitter, with spiced dark fruits. ThereÂ’s a creamy oat backbone that really grounds everything, leading to a big beer that never goes too over the top. ItÂ’s controlled and extremely tasty.

Muddy brown with a dark tan head. Poured this one a bit too cold, but the smell is potent nonetheless, and quickly grows in complexity. Strikingly well balanced aroma that combines dark chocolate, coffee, and a wonderfully umami palette of soy sauce, teriyaki and miso. Some bright berries also shine through, notably red currants and cranberries. That beautiful balances extends onto the palate with a smooth, rich flavor that complements the nose. The aftertaste is a perfect Â– the slight bitterness of roasted coffee, the chewy oatmeal softness and a burst of juicy raisins. I had pegged Beer Geek Breakfast as a bombastic stout in my mind, but I was surprised to find a well-mannered, nuanced brew. This is a gentlemanÂ’s beer and simply an excellent stout.

Black with medium brown head. Intense raw coffee, tobacco and some alcohol. Same strong coffee with tobacco, chocolate and smoke. Thick and viscous with a smooth palate and a surprisingly abrupt finish. I quite like it.

Coffee, chocolate and ash, practically black with a very persistant brown head, medium body, law carbonation, taste of coffee, and chocolate quite bitter in the final...can be a greatful morning with this.
Bottle. Big brown head. Taste like coffe, dark chocholate, oats, a little bit sour.
Dark black pour with small persistent brown head. Not much aroma. Flavor is bitter but little else. IÂ’m a bit underwhelmed for the hype this gets.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee notes, and oats. Warming finish with some bitterness and acidity. An excellent stout.

Aroma: sweetness, coffee and stout mixed together; much better than average stout; Appearance: pitch black with creamy tan head that dissipates very slowly; Taste: reverts back to a traditional stout (not as nice as aroma) but still a much more complex flavor that builds on the tongue; smooth, pleasant coffee flavor; Palate: heavy body with creamy, sweet finish; Overall: while still not my favorite style, definitely the best stout IÂ’ve ever had.

Bevuta intensa, con un bel corpo e consistenza leggermente oleosa, alcol presente, malto tostato, cioccolato, caffÃ¨, vaniglia. Cremosa e poco frizzante. Davvero grande Stout.

In bottiglia. Colore nero caffÃ© impenetrabile. Schiuma nocciola a shampoo, cremosa morbida, di dissolvenza abbastanza rapida. Naso tostato e di lievito, con note di zucchero parzialmente bruciato, caramello, torrone, nocciole e crosta di pane. Carbonazione flat. Ottimo aroma maltato, rotondo, di perfetto equilibrio e levigatura, con avena, crosta di pane, cioccolata, caramello, caffÃ¨, nocciole amare e frutta scura candita. Gusto leggermente dolce, poi amaro rotondo. Corpo leggero, trama lattica appena oleosa. Una stout dÂ’avena praticamente perfetta, non a caso eletta tra le migliori al mondo, fresca, scorrevole e dissetante, setosa leggera e di strabiliante equilibrio.

Bottle at home with my wife. Pour is deep black with a small brown head and good lacing. Big cocoa, toffee, some tobacco, earthy hips, caramel, coffee, and raisins in the aroma. Taste is tobacco, leather, espresso, toasted malt, black malt, and cookies with a lingering coffee aftertaste. Medium body with medium carbonation. Solid.

Bottle at home. Pours coffee black with thin head. Aroma was somewhat plain with dark malt notes, some coffee and faint dark chocolate. Medium body with some back bone, not too heavy. Taste is roasty coffee, oatmeal, semi bitter dark chocolate and maybe a touch of ash on a lingering finish. Solid breakfast stout although pretty basic (but done well) and pricey. I prefer Cocoa Shake or the Flat White.

0.33 l bottle from Â’De BierkoningÂ’, best before May 2019. Pitch black with a thin, fluffy, rather quickly diminishing, brown head. Sweetish, roasty-malty aroma with lots of coffee, burnt nuts, tobacco, some licorice and dark chocolate. Sweetish, roasty-malty taste of coffee, dark chocolate, some licorice, tobacco and burnt nuts, followed by a short, roasty-bitter finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice, but the aroma promised a bit more, body is a bit thin as well. Maybe too old already.

7.3%ABV. Breakfast Stout

Tapped out black. 40ÂºSRM.

Nose has some nice roasted malt goodness. Smoke and umami.

Mouthfeel is soapy. Palate is crammed full of deeply roasted flavors: burnt toast, burnt ends, burnt roast pork, char Siew ends. There are also more full bodied malt flavors of black bread, rye toast, Hops if present are bitter and resinous. The alcoholic palate accentuates the resinous favor of the hops.

Finish is smoky and bitter with alcohol in the back of the throat.

Goes on Favorites List!

Served on tap at Moor Pat. Dark black color with a brown head. Roasted malt expresso aroma. Coffee roasted malt toffee flavor. Medium body. Tastes like a well roasted coffee.

Pours a dark mahogany almost black with big fluffy tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, and some smokey notes. Flavors of dark malts, coffee, and some smooth chocolate notes.

Pours black with brown head. Medium body. Huge roasted malts and coffee, extremely smooth throughout with a sweetness to finish
Along with Yves at his home black colored body with off white head and a malt hops coffee dark fruity aroma a hops malt coffee herby alcholic bitter taste with alcholic bitter finish
Shared with wim at my home. Black colored beer with medium brownish head. Coffee hopped. Full sparkling palate. Finish is coffee malty bitter.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Thick black color with thin light brown head and sticky oily lacing. Aroma has huge velvety coffee and chocolate. Flavor is intense- strong coffee, malts, smoky, and cocoa. Ridiculously expensive at $6.99/bottle, but good.
Not sure why this stout is rated so highly. Too much carbonation, bitter and short on coffee flavor.

Tap at Brewdog. Nice beer. Blackish-brown. Toasty. Rich tasting. Coffee. A bit thin at the end loses a couple of points.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark pour off white head, aroma is burnt hop, malt, roast, licorice and coffee. Flavor is hoppy and bitter, evidently from the chocolate, coffee and hops used. Roasted barley and oats abound.
12-Mar-2016-0,33L Flasche. Fast schwarz, hellbrauner Schaum. Aroma: Laktitz, Melasse, Espresso. Antrunk Bitterschokolade, Kaffee, RÃ¶stmalz, ordentliche RestsÃ¼ÃŸe/ gut ausbalanciert.

33cl Bottle - BBD= 26/03/2016
I waited some time to try this beer, but wasnÂ’t entirely my thing. Minimal head, carbonation was low. I guessed I expected it to be less bitter and more complex. Overall it was a decent beer.
Pretty amazing, great coffee flavour, and exquisite malts. What good Imperial Stouts should stand for.

@BKL 2016, Munich. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, toffee and vanilla. Taste of dark chocolate, roasted cereals, caramel and a lot of coffee; reminding me of Dahny Sahne Cappuccino. On top one of the greatest mouthfeels you can get from a beer, thick and foamy covering your mouth with this liquid breakfast. Nice balance between sweet- and bitterness. "Just hook it to my veins!"

@BKL, Munich; exceptional nose of, yes, cornflakes and french press coffee; already a strong hint that this is one of those quite rare landscape-like beers, evoking a breakfast scene, sun on wood in a lightbathed kitchen, fresh ground coffee, slightly burnt toast in the background. Wow!

Tasted from a bottle. It poured opaque with a big frothy brown head that had some staying power, and heavy lacing. Deep roasted malt aroma. Very smooth and drinkable with a rich coffee and chocolate malt taste. Slightly bitter up top yet extremely well balanced. Shared the bottle with my wife, but enjoyed it so much I Bogarted most of it.
Dark pour with almost two fingers of tan head from the bottle. Coffee with a hint of caramel aroma. Very roasty coffee followed by molasses and fig taste. Solid beer.

On tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and vanilla. A slightly sour edge and a little spice, although that could be the Thai food from earlier. Dry bitter finish.

Bottled, enjoyed on my birthday-morning. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma is lots of roast, coffee, chocolate, wood, and tobacco/almost smoky notes. Flavor is roast, coffee, bitter chocolate, and wood/leather. Has a dry, slightly bitter, chalky feel. This is by far the best stout i have had so far!

Smell of coffee 

Taste of malt, coffee, some chocolate, weak alcohol taste

Overall for me is a smooth stout that doesnÂ’t the sour/spicy aftertaste. Medium to thick body. 

I could drink this for breakfast thatÂ’s for sure. A good 4.0!
Smooth dark chocolate and nicely roasted coffee. Notes of brown sugar, molasses and lightly toasted grains. This beer is expertly blended.
Extremely carbonated, so if you are opening a bottle, beware. Bitter coffee scent and taste. Very full mouth feel. Not much taste aside from the coffee. A little disappointing. Bottle.
Classic. Much coffee and as much body as can be expected from a stout with a relatively low amount of alcohol.

Bottle 33cl. Pitch black with a foamy brown head. Thick viscosity. Strong aroma of coffee, dark bitter chocolate. Flavour compliments the aroma. Long lasting finish where coffee is the most dominant. Nice bitterness, which makes this beer so nice to drink.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2017 Drank with Bram at my room during Stukafest Nijmegen 02-02-2016. Okay beer, but a bit disappointing. Mainly coffee taste and quite thin beer. Not very special/comprehensive.

Drank with Rik in at Pivo 100 in Bratislava (fourth beer of the tasting), 08-02-2017. Rated a bit higher. Noticed the metally, alcohol taste.
Bottle at home, black beer, small/medium head. Aroma is coffee filter, roasted coffee, malts. Taste is malts, roasted coffee, bitter dry. nice one

Nice smooth mocha / dark chocolatey aroma. 
Pours completely black, pretty lasting brown head. 
Taste in the beginning was very balanced between mocha and bittersweet dark chocolate. As it warms it becomes more chocolate sweet. 
Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. 
Nice coffee stout.
This is a great brew. Oats and a bit of coffee bitters and maybe smoke make this brew unique. For breakfast? Not quite sure about that but very enjoyable.

Arrived in a snifter.

3.25 A: Black color. Came with just the slightest medium brown head.

3.75 S: Big coffee - deep roast. Very raw malty, grainy. Resiny with herbal hops.

2.5 T: Overly roasty and charred. Lacking depth. Too dry with too much hop bitterness.

2.5 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Lacking creaminess.

2.5 D: Overly bitter. No good.

â˜… 374 characters


DavoleBomb, Jun 30, 2015

330 ml bottle into snifter, bottled on 9/7/2015. Pours nearly pitch black color with a 1 finger dense and fluffy tan head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted oats, dark bread, light nuttiness, herbal, pine, light smoke/char, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of roast/bready malt, coffee, and earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted oats, dark bread, light nuttiness, herbal, pine, light smoke/char, and roasted/toasted earthiness. Moderate pine and roast/char bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, toasted oats, dark bread, light nuttiness, smoke, char, herbal, pine, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt, coffee, and earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitter/sweet balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from hop/roast bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready, and sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent American styled oatmeal stout. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt, coffee, and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Aroma of roasted, coffee and hints of chocolate. Taste is much the same but with dark fruits and caramel as well. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter.

Bottle. Pours is dark with very thick brown head. Sweet aroma, dark coffee, dark chocolate, wood, roasted malt, tobacco. Taste is light sweet, light to moderate bitter with just a hint of acidic notes, roasted malts on tongue. Dry, medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation, coffee bittery finish. Awesomely ballanced.

Pours a jet black with a thin tan head. Aroma is lots of roast, coffee, chocolate, wood, and tobacco/almost smoky notes. Flavor is roast, coffee, bitter chocolate, and wood/leather. Has a dry, slightly bitter, chalky feel. This is probably the manliest stout ever, something that would go perfectly with a cigar. Quite good.
Dark brown with medium creamy beige head. Roasted malt aroma. Roasted malt taste remarkable hoppy bitterness and coffee, some chocolate and vanilla notes. Slight bitter aftertaste.

33cl bottle sampled several months ago (review from memory) - heavy on the coffee, roasted malts and a bit of dark chocolate. A bit more light-bodied than I would have preferred, but otherwise an excellent brew.
Black with tan head. Hoppy, tropical fruit, ash and burnt coffee bean. Dry, Smooth and earthy finish. Overall: nice and hoppy stout!

Quite black with just a little brown head that lasts. Tastes of roasted coffee, bitter chocolate, smoke, dark caramel, nuts, leather, vanilla and some spruce. Heavy-medium body, smooth carbonation and finish of roasted coffee, bitterness and dry leaves. Burnt, bitter and overshadowed by its big brother, but still a good beer

the nose features mild coffee, cream, chocolate and a whiff of sawdust. This is a relatively understated and well balanced stout. The taste profile features mild coffee, mocha, cocoa and cream. It has a nice clean finish.

Barwa ciemna piana super. Zapach palonej , mielonej kawy. W smaku mega mocna kwasno gorzka kawa. Piwo bardzo ciekawe wlasciwie smakuje jak mocne espresso. Troche dziwne jest to.1 miejsce w kategorii stout ale warte skosztowania.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into a snifter. The aroma is initially cherry but turns to leather, charcoal, and oatmeal, with a touch of raisin sweetness. The beer is a dark mahogany with a brown, sudsy head that has a light retention and lace. The taste is a high and cloying bitter with a light medium sweet. The slick texture is acompanied by a light, thin carbonation/ The medium body contains notes of coffee, leather, tobacco, and a hint of oatmeal. The finish is coffee with some oats, and the sticky aftertaste is dry and bitter, with burnt coffee and lingering ashy notes.
On tap @ LÃºpulo Feroz. Color is pitch black with persistent grey head. Nose and flavor are coffee, roasted malts and a little oat hints.

Color negro, spuma beige, sabor cafe torrefacto, dulce, cuerpo medio, gran cerveza

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black with a nice beige head. Aroma is roasted malt and coffee with notes of smoke and charcoal. The flavour is Chocolate sweet at first - then fresh piney hops comes in before the burnt Coffee-flavours takes over and finish in a long balanced bitterness. Smooth and balanced. Such a good beer - i understand all the fuzz about it...

Bottle. Jet black with nice almost brown head with good retention. Medium to full body, rather low carbonated. Intensive aroma of coffee, chocolate and caramel, with some malty notes. In taste coffee comes first, also some roasted malts, very smooth with little bit bitterness at the end. Very good and very drinkable.

Pitch black color with great brown head. Aroma has tones of fresh and roasted coffee beans, also dark chocolate. Taste is so coffee forward, intense, with espresso and fresh coffee beans as well. Great aftertaste, bitter and really marked. Nothing more to say, coffee, coffee and more coffee.

Pours black with a tan head. Coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, oat and caramel aroma. Dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, caramel, soy sauce, earthy hop, toast and mild booze flavors. Medium full body with moderate carbonation. Cocoa, coffee and almost burn roasted malt finish.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 Bottle at csakajosor. Pitch black colour good brown head. Nose is coffee. Taste is mild bitterness with well balaced coffee. Full mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle - 2008 vintage - pours a dark brown with thin tan head . Soft coffee , cocoa aroma . Medium body with similar flavors . Not bad but I think it may have faded a bit .

Pours a deep black color, topped with a medium sized brown cream head, fairly lasting. Aroma is very easy to pick up, some nice chocolate notes with coffee dominating over them, though not too intrusive. Taste is gently sweet, some chocolate notes up front, gentle coffee feel and some bitterness in the finish. Very gentle but lasting roasted coffee aftertaste. Creamy and smooth, full taste but has that light feel to it. Very lovely, superbly drinkable.

From tap. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of heavy roasted malts, coffee (LOTS!), light licorice, light chocolate. Roasted malts and coffee dominates the aroma in a very pleasant way. Taste is heavy on coffee, loooots of roasted malts, quite bitter, light cocoa and chocolate, light licorice. I get notes of vanilla, which I donÂ’t normally do in a non barrel aged stout. Super balanced, despite the heavy bitterness and the roasted malts.

I can now vouch for the fact that this Beer Geek release really does go quite well with breakfast. Breakfast pour black with about two fingers of cocoa-colored head. Aroma has a lovely ground coffee character. Flavor has bittersweet bakerÂ’s chocolate, roasted grains, and fresh, bold coffee. Feel is smooth and rich. This truly is a beer deserving of the dayÂ’s most important meal. All the better if youÂ’re needing some hair of the dog treatment. (IÂ’m not saying I needed it.)

Nera, densa e mediamente schiumosa. Un concentrato di malto e caffÃ¨, meno cioccolatoso dellÂ’atteso sinceramente. Una buona stout senza dubbio, che racchiude tutte le caratteristiche tipiche dello stile ma che aggiunge ben poco di nuovo (degno di nota lÂ’equilibrio complessivo). Bottle pour into tulip glass from RedstoneÂ’s Liquors, Stoneham, MA. Aroma is chocolatey and coffee, roasted malts. Appearance is opaque black with persistent light brown ring of head with mild lacing. Taste is moderate sweet chocolate with moderate coffee bitterness that dominates second half. Palate is light bodied with thin texture and dry bitter coffee finish. Overall, very good but dominated a bit more by bitter than I like and a little thin.

Nero impenetrabile, poca schiuma marrona scuro.

Jeg smagte den igÃ¥r pÃ¥ Mikkeller i Stefansgade som fadÃ¸l. Awesome! Det er flydende kage!
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2016 Bottle. Intensive coffee aroma, almost black, nice creamy head. Roasty taste, bitter finish

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, some sweet hoppy notes: fruity, resin, herbal. Great composition, very intensive. Appearance: Color is black, head is low but nice looking: beige, dense and durable. Taste: A great composition of coffee, chocolate and roasty notes connected with hoppy sweet notes in the background, bitterness is mostly coffee-like, very dry. Palate: Finish is dry, body is medium, carbonation is low.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Pours black color, haze/opaque, with big, stable creamy light brown head. Visually low carbonation.
Aroma with strong note of roasted malts, with roasted coffee like character. Hop aroma is low, with hints of pine.
Flavor is very high roasted malt, which takes on coffee, roasted coffee beans, tobacco, bittersweet chocolate. 
Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness moderate medium. Hop flavors takes on pine, dark fruits, reisins.
Finish is slightly bitter/dry. Body is medium, texture is because of oat silky smooth, carbonation is low.

UnÂ’outmeal stout di grande spessore. Si presenta di un color nero, con riflessi lievi ramati, schiuma fine marroncino ed evanescente. Al naso predomina il caffÃ¨ e poco spazio Ã¨ lasciato ai luppoli, che invece predominano nel finale, molto amaro e resinoso. Il corpo ben strutturato, con carbonazione bassa e bollicine finissime, Ã¨ molto morbido per via dellÂ’avena. Sorso pieno, facile bevuta e buon retrogusto.

Dated best by January 29, 2018 enjoyed October 21, 2015 in a Mad Elf tulip/snifter.

Look - Dark brown body. Slow to develop tan head fine to medium bubbles dissipates quickly to a ring. I am not seeing much sediment as expected. Pin point lacing and nothing more. 

Smell - Chocolate. Coffee. Sweet.

Taste - Chocolate. Coffee. Cardboard. Char. 

Feel - I like how heavy it is for abv. Carbonation explodes with swallow. 

Overall - Not as dirty as I like my breakfast stouts. More on the milk chocolate side as opposed to dark chocolate. Light on the char. Nice feel for their low abv stout.

the aroma of caramel, roasted malt, chocolate, toast, wood and toffee... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of cocoa, robust, toast, oak barrel and dark fruits... sweet, dry and bitter aftertaste...

330ml bottle enjoyed @ home, 2 year old bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is pleasant coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate and some smoke. Flavour is medium bitter and medium sweet. Full bodied, semi-oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is coffee bitterness and dry.

Bottiglia, colore nero impenetrabile con una schiuma mediamente persistente, al naso emergono note tostate con una nota di caffÃ¨ lunghissima a farla da padrone, al palato si riconferma il caffÃ¨ unito al malto e nel finale una leggerissima luppolatura. Fantastica stout.

Poured from 11.2oz brown bottle into nucleated schooner glass, an opaque black colour with deep sudsy brown foam, long-lasting with fine lace. Beautiful. Rich malts, grainy, fruity, dark chocolate, dark coffee, brown bread, toast with orange marmalade, roasty, stone fruit esters, pleasant sharpness from burnt barley grains. Somehow both chewy and creamy. Sweet and bitter. Smooth and tart. Full-bodied and dry-finish. I know they use Centennial and Cascade hops, but this has a definite English Fuggles-ish earthiness too. Full-bodied, big chewy mouthfeel, subtle tannins and mineral essence, average carbonation, lingering multi-layered aftertastes with a hoppy snap and bright coffee acidity at finish. God this is insanely delicious, one of the best beers IÂ’ve ever tasted, difficult to imagine a more perfect combination of flavours.
Hands down one of the best beers there is! Very complex yet balanced taste-diversity. Nice dark malts and licorice, but still enough dark chocholate and hop bitterness to give enough edge.

Bottle. Inky black with small foamy tan head, mocha aroma, sweetish starting taste followed by coffee bitterness, full body, long bitter coffee finish with alcohol undertones. Thick bodied and robust.

Pours black with a thin tan head. Smells of chocolate and coffee. Slightly more bitter than expected, with loads of coffee.

Persistent foam. Scent senses are sharpened by the meeting with high-quality coffee and light pleasant hop, while the taste buds angrily turned on the hard roasted malt tones of coffee easily gentle bitterness and slightly English licorice gently holds it all together until hop bitterness takes over prolonged aftertaste. If you close your eyes sharpened taste impression and the brain gets the necessary time and space to the aforementioned impressions. There are not enough words of praise for the Beer Geek Breakfast. It is far too profound and all-encompassing.

Pours black, nice brown head. Great, very intense, roasted aroma of coffee and chocolate. Very complex taste - sour, then sweet and bitter at finish. Notes of coffee in this beer are simply amazing. Medium bitterness, very smooth. Great!

On cask. Pours a dark black with thin brown head. Has a strong coffee/espresso and chocolate aroma. Taste is strong with chocolate, roasted malts, coffee/espresso, grains and light dark fruit. A very dry malt and grain aftertaste.

A milky, smoky nose. Thick-ish with burnt malt and coffee flavors. I like how much that coffee and roast contributes. I feel the oats late in the throat. ItÂ’s a little too smoky for me but you can tell itÂ’s a good beer and you can tell who makes it.
Pours a nice brown/black color with no real head retention or lacing. Has an off smell, but tastes like lightly burnt coffee and dark chocolate. A good beer that is a victim of its appearance.
Pours black, good head, aroma of coffee, creamy chocolate. Slightly bitter, hoppy, chocolate coffee, black cherry. Very good.

Black with a small brown head. Aroma of coffee, smoke, chocolate, licorice and pine. Taste is bitter, mild sweet and very light acidic. It is well balanced and has a long after-taste. Body is full,  texture is creamy and carbonation is soft.
Now this I like! WasnÂ’t sure what to expect from a Norwegian stout but it more than delivered. Rich, deep flavour with the right amount of coffee kick at the end, lovely.

Bottle, pours black and tan. Roast, espresso, pine, citrus, chocolate. Quite some hop bitterness, creamy, medium body, average carbonation, bitter chocolate and coffee finish. Nice (if you like coffee), not too complex.

Black as hell with a dark tan head. Bitter coffee and creamy malts. Dark chocolate. Delicious. A really perfect oatmeal stout. I like the ones which might include a little vanilla personally, but this is really great.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2017 Black, small but steady head. Aroma: coffee, roasty, caramel, licorice. Medium to light body, medium sweetness, medium to low bitterness. Nice balance, very smooth, quite long, but nice, roasty finish. Some sour from roasted malts, but also some sweetness. Lighter than ris, but very rich.

Tap - good size tam cited thick head, pitch black color, big roasty and alcohol aroma and flavor with a little coffee coming through at the end (not as much as expected, but that's good for me as I'm not a coffee fan), smooth finish, pretty good overall

Strong coffee notes. Lacks the complexity and body that I'd hoped for. Light enough to truly be a breakfast.

Sabor ahumado con gran cuerpo a cafÃ©, grano torrefacto con un fondo dulce y duraredo. Un elixir perfecto para desayunar y beber a cualquier hora. Una gran stout compleja y de calidad enorme.
Ehn. Dry stout. Nice coffee but not much else. Ehn. Definitely quite overrated. Good if you like coffee dumped in your guiness.

Black beer, walnut colored head. Aroma roasty, coffee, chocolate cookies, faint metal. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate cookies, some vanilla, a little dark fruit. Palate is rich, for a stout, carbonation a bit bright. Finish is dry, coffee is heavy in this, but I like coffee.

Black with thin, dark coloured head. Thick, silky texture. Although thereÂ’s plenty of dark roast malts and coffee flavour it retains a certain sweetness making it very drinkable. Coffee flavours linger in the aftertaste.

This is a beer of legends that was also presented by our Danish partner and friends. It is so simple (it seems), you brew up a stout that is neither too sweet nor to sour and give it a well rounded dominant roast, coffee and caramel finish. A beer of champions that is certainly on the beer bucket list.

Aroma: Rich coffee, subtle vanilla

Appearance: Thick creamy dark brown head and beautiful black colour

Taste: Rich vanilla starts, savory milky taste runs, finishes dry & subtle coffee flavour

Palate: Medium full body and thick creamy texture of the oatmeal, soft carbonation, and astringent & bitter finish of coffee

Overall: So complex, the best oatmeal stout(not Â’ImperialÂ’) IÂ’ve ever eaten.

Black pour with a creamy khaki head. Lacing coats the glass. Smells like cold brewed coffee with vanilla creamer. Taste is strong coffee and bitter dark chocolate with some sweet caramel in the background. Creamy velvety texture.

Bottle. Pours a black colour with a thin, mocha head. Aroma of roasted malts, freshly brewed coffee, ash, some chocolate, smoke, oats and raisin. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, earth, some smoke, subtle raisin, prune, slight alcohol, smoke and burnt tones. Full bodied and soft carbonation. A full on, roasted coffee bitterness with subtle fruitiness in the finish. A superb stout, well worth the hype. Glorious roasted coffee aroma and flavour with some fruit. Thick and strong too. More like a imperial stout.
Bottle from Cornelius. Chocolate and coffee in perfect harmony with some sharp boozy cherry. Balanced and very drinkable.

From 22 oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a nice dark brown/black. Nose is big coffee, mocha, caramel, roasted malt, smoke. Taste is butter, medium heavy body. Smooth mouthfeel, finishes sharp on the palate. Awesome beer

12 oz. bottle poured at my brotherÂ’s house in Methuen, MA. Pours black with a slight tan head that died quickly. Smells like coffee (and a bit of chocolate?). Tastes like coffee and has a nice bitter finish. Touch of carbonation but not much. This is a great beer. Wish I had more than one.
Extremely drinkable...maybe even at breakfast (although itÂ’s dinner time right now).

Bottle from Martins West in Redwood City. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, mild tartness / acidity that is lovely. Not as smooth on the mouthfeel considering the oatmeal. Very good... but with a score of 100 and coming from Mikkeller I think I was expecting something more exceptional.

Appearance: this beer pours with a small tan head, the beer is very black but has some small brown hues on the edges in the light
Aroma: coffee, dark roasted malt 
Taste: coffee bitterness, not especially sweet, bitter finish 
Palate: average carbonation, creamy thick mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste 
Overall: I'm not picking up much complexity but it's very well executed, coffee with a nice creamy mouthfeel are the predominant aspects I'm my mind, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle
Color: completely black.
Head: beautiful beige head.
Aroma: coffee, coffee and chocolate.
Taste: amazing balanced coffee with chocolate. Then the dark malts kicks in with great roasted taste. 
AMAZING BEER - Definitely my all time favorite when ti comes to coffee stouts.

Pours black with a soapy tan head. Aroma is of coffee and chocolate and so is the flavor. Aftertaste is that of espresso. ItÂ’s drinkable and quite enjoyable, but I expected a little more. I am not finding its uniqueness.

black color,
medium creamy brown head
thick oily body, funny paints glass on brown
aroma, roasted grains of coffee, not the esspresso liquid but, pure grains, strong coffee punch in the nose and the tongue!
after few sips, you feel dark chocolate also.
after drunk many coffee beers that is for sure the best so far,
I think oatmeal make some job here, this beer is very smooth.
liked it, but for sure if you dont like coffee just, grab something else :)

Bottle. Sensoric glass. Pitch black with medium, brownish, densed head. Medicore head retention, great lacing. Clear roasted malts aroma. Great and highly intense aroma of coffee, dried, black fruits. Also a touch of milk chocolate aroma is noticable. Taste is medium bitter with some intensification in the end. Light to medium coffee sourness. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, finish is bitter and semi-dry. No alcohol warming. In overall perfectly brewed stout for coffee geeks. Once again MIkkeller shows the evidence how should beer brewed with coffee look like.

It had the faintest aroma of a good, strong, black coffee and hops. It poured black as ink and had a mild, tan head which almost seemed to glow against the darkness of the stout. Its taste was incredibly smooth with an espresso taste. There were other subtle flavors underneath, but I couldnÂ’t identify them. It finished with a pleasurable hoppy bitterness. This is saying a lot from me as I am not generally a fan of hops. Surprisingly it had light body with a creamy texture. This was truly an excellent stout.
Dark brown with red tint and tan head. Aroma is sweet, malty, choclate. Taste follows nose. Very creamy. Chasing a omelet style case role after a late breakfast. Nice.
Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Shared with Miro. Pours dark brown with brown head. Chocolate aroma. Roasted malty, bit smokey, coffee, chocolate. Bitter finish.

On tap at owl farm. Pitch black, silky pour. Heavily bitter but smooth at the same time. Intense but nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black body, small brown head. Strong coffee aroma, cocoa, alcohol, roasted malt, raisin notes of vanilla. Flavour of coffee, cocoa, roasted malt, more coffee, alcohol warmth. Long coffee biter finish. Full body, low carbo. Stunning.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable, creamy tan head. Clear aroma of malt, fruit, roast and coffee. Bitter, roasty and coffeelike flavour, with malty notes and touches of caramel and yeast. Roasty aftertaste with notes of coffee. Soft carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel. Well-balanced, not too strong and very enjoyable. A really good stout. Yummy. My Danish rating #1000 :-)

(Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 7.5%
Black colour on the body, one finger of thick and creamy, dark brown head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma has oats, liquorice, plenty of coffee, roasted malts, vanilla, light alcohol, even more coffee as it warms up.
Taste mainly of coffee, lots of roasted malts too, nice dark bitter chocolate notes, with a nice bitterness on the finish and the aftertaste.
Medium thin body, soft carbonation. 
Very good.

Bottle from Tacoma boys. Pours black, tan head. Scent is roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate, some hops. Tasty beer!
Looked forward to try this beer. Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt. Taste: lots of coffee, chocolate, good bitterness! Great beer.

-strong coffee and tobacco,hazelnut,nougat
T:

Pours deep black with medium brown head. Nose is coffee and raisin, with a milky touch. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, raisin, dark fruits, with a piney note. Low carbonation, creamy texture. Long roasty finish. Astounding coffee stout!

330ml bottle from Mikkeller bottle shop. Black, fluffy tan head. Roasted coffee aroma, bitter spices, light smokiness. Very tasty, coffee, roasted espresso beans, grilled lemon, meat marinade, green herbs, mildly sour. Medium carbonated bubbles that feels back in the mouth, creamy mouthfeel. Sweet and bitter in the finish.
On tap at Erz Winti. Pours dark black. Aroma of oatmeal, almost bread-like. Intense perfect taste of roast malts and good hops, perfectly balanced and well finished. An impressive stout indeed.

Bottle. Dark brown/black colour with dark brown medium head.
Aroma is mainly licorice, also bit cocoa and hints of vanilla.
Taste is dominated by coffee with some cocoa, vanilla, hops and roasted malts.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Finish is coffee, roasted malts and hops.

33cl bottle from Ã–l Huset in Helsinki. Was expecting for more, but still this was stout made to perfection. Oliy dark brown, almost black, color with small long lasting cappucino head. Super smooth body with excellent flavors of toasted rye, dark coffee and cocoa nibs. Usual Mikkeller quality, but not near the best of ones I tasted.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 0.33 bottle. Dark brown color and a small brownish head. Aroma of dark malts, some coffee, cocoa, and most importantly wood and smoked pork. Taste is very malty, dark chocolate, again wood, smoked ham. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is overcome by coffee. Overall quite a good beer, but then again itÂ’s hard to mess up a stout. I like the transition it makes from smoke to coffee.

o,33l fles bij melgers vandaan. zwart met een licht bruine schuimkraag. geur met koffie, lactose en in de verte hars. smaak met gebrande bitterheid, extra pure chocolade. afdronk is trekkend, vol en bitter.

Bottle. Aroma is dark malt and dry coffee. Appearance is motor oil black with little, if any, tan head. Taste is coffee and oat with black malt. Plate is dry and espresso with a hint towards cardboard. Overall, a very well done stout. Would like to try some of the other renditions of this brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A 330ml bottle with a best before date on the bottle cap of 20th May 2019, and poured into a snifter glass. The beer poured pitch black with maybe just under one finger tan head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving nice stringy lacing. Aromas mainly of coffee and dark chocolate along with some slight cognac alcohol and raisin smells. Espresso coffee taste dominates throughout along with a bit of dark chocolate leaving a long lingering bitter aftertaste. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. A creamy beginning but dry finish. Overall, I enjoyed this a lot as I regularly drink black coffee and the lingering bitter aftertaste was excellent. I would be very interested to try out all the different barrel aged versions if I ever get my hands on those bottles. However, this is not quite there at Founders Breakfast Stout level which is still my favourite non BA coffee based stout.

bottle. Thick black with small head. Very nice stout with huge coffee. I appreciate that while full-flavored, this is not overdone at all. Having had both this and the Anchorage variety, IÂ’d give a very slight advantage to the AK version for complexity.

Amazingly viscous pour. Black and opaque, with small head, lacing. Smell is weak compared to taste, but hoppy and roasted. At least the aroma stays in the liquid! Little tart, roasted, smokeyish, licorice, coffee of course. Bitter and roasted lingering finish. Light carbonation, very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Very pleasant at night, at breakfast I am not ready yet!
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 Tap. Black, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, & long finish.
Butelka. Kawowe, czekoladowe, lekko kwaskowe, treÅ›ciwe, ale bardzo pijalne, przyjemne, gÅ‚adkie.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2015 On tap at La Tape (6,3,7,3,13). Brownish head with good retention. Very dark mahogany colour, almost opaque black. Aroma is black coffee, dried black fruits (prune) with hop hints.Taste is dry, roasted malt, black coffee, dry hoppy bitterness. Full body and slightly oily palate.
Bottle at home. (7,4,8,4,16): Small brownish head with low retention.  Very dark mahogany colour, almost opaque black. Chocolate aroma, cream, liquorice, roasted malts and diacetyl presence. Taste is Burnt malt, dark cocoa, black coffee dry bitterness and some hop notes. Creamy and medium oily palate with dry bitter aftertaste. A dry and very good breakfast beer.
Chocolate smell with smoked coffe. Deep dark color with low brown head. Incredibly bitter taste, itÂ’s like a very charged coffee, very complex on the mouth.

Bottle. Black with very nice white head. In aroma fruity coffee, roastiness, dark chocolate. In taste roastiness, coffee, fruits, very nice stout. Very oily texture, medium high body, low carbonated. The beer is very smooth. Great coffee stout.

Bottle at home picked up from Bottledog KingsX. Oily viscous, velvety black / dark brown coloured pour with a thin tan head. Some reddy hues. Aroma is sweet creamy smooth roast coffee, sweet berry, strawberry, earthy ashy. Little bitter dark choc on the nose as well. Palate is full and velvety on the tongue, moderate to high carbonation. Flavour is composed of earthy roast coffee, ashy roast, coffee round the campfire, bitter roast, dark chocolate, nice fullness from the oats. Very enjoyable.

bottle at home as a present from Saeglopur, many thanks Thomas :) black color, looks rather oily, small dark coffee-colored head. strong smell of coffee roast, chocolate, some dark fruits. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation also light bubbly down the throat, light oily mouthfeel. medium strong roasty taste. tastes of chocolate, coffee, light sour-ish, some light hop bitterness, light citric and grass notes, light alcoholic but overall alcoholic nicely hidden. roasty bitter / chocolate / lightly hoppy finish. wow, very nice one, drinks rather easy.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Deep black with a short-lived soapy tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark cherries, roasted grains and vanilla. Silky smooth on the palate with bitter and tart flavors working well together. As it warms up more of the tartness shows. The oats really give it a creamy, velvety mouthfeel. Great long and lingering dry bitter finish.

Strong taste of oats and dark chocolate with a black coffee backbone. Smells of black coffee. Pours pitch black with a thick tan head. Had a bottle pour at home. Decent beer

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2015 (04/27/2015) Bottle at home. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, hint of smoke, roasted malts, coffee, hint of sour sweet red fruits.Taste is hoppy bitter followed by bitter sweet chocolate and coffee, roasted malts, oats, dry finish with a bitter hoppy coffee dark chocolate aftertaste. Creamy mouth feel. Very nice, but not as good as I expected. Happy to give this another shot though. 8/4/8/4/15
(06/05/2015). On tap at the BeerTemple. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of damp basement, roasted malts, hint of chocolate. Taste is sweet with bitter coffee and chocolate, bitter almost hoppy ending with a hint of chocolate in there. Long dark chocolate aftertaste. Bottle was a lot better, maybe something went wrong here... 6/4/8/3/14

Pitch black color. Big espresso notes, dark cherries, caramel and excellent roastiness. The mouth is flawless with the roasted malt smoothly blending in with the coffee notes. Very smooth. Long lingering finish moderate bitterness and espresso notes.
Drank from a bottle. Super good beer, my new favourite! Strong coffee flavour together with all the stouty goodnesses.

On tap at Solijca bar in Belgrade-Serbia. Pours oil bleach with a brownish little foam which lowers fast, leaves lacing and drafts. Nose: licorice, coffee, grass. In the bouts the hops bitter this stout making it very drinkable. Carbonation is medium, coffee is hidden.

Black. Tan head. Bitterness from the coffee. Texture gets thickness in the oatmeal. Great balance. Gets better as it warms.

Black color with big beige head. A bit smokey malt, oatmeal, cocoa and coffee. Taste is rich, more oatmeal, cocoa, coffee, stays dry and not sweet. Super!

Pitch black pouring slowly to no head.
Tastes coal and dry cocoa. Definately graphite rather than coffee. Light bitter pleasant aftertaste. A dense complex personality! Not for breafast, but for a Hamburg..
winter afternoon!

Pitch black with light brown foam. The smell is mainly roasted and a little bit bacon. The taste is to me like dissolved black coal dust in a coffee. I donÂ’t like coffee and coal isnÂ’t my favorite either. Dry aftertaste to finish. I donÂ’t understand the hype.

Very good breakfast stout, with red fruit sweetness mixing with the high grain content, dark chocolate and coffee. Medium to full body, low carb with a small beige head fading from the top of a dark, dark brew. You know what this should look, taste and smell like - it does. Bitter finish sneaks up on you then lingers just like it should...

Bottle from bottleo in reykjavik. Black with rich tan head. Aroma is strong coffee and dark choxolate, liquorice and a hint of cherry. Taste is strong bitterness and a bit salty. Nice oily body and subtle carbonation. Nice stout.

Pours jet black with off white head. Aroma is heavy coffee, some chocolate and dark fruits. Very balanced aroma even with all that coffee.

Taste is very smooth and oily. Coffee is what drives this stout and it does it wonderfully. Top class stout!

Bottle from Mikkellers webshop.

Bottle at home. Pours black with big dark brown head. Aroma of roasted and burnt malts, coffee and oats. Mostly coffee. Taste is dryish with oats and coffee, cacao. Palate is carbonated, dry and surprisingly a bit thin. The carbonation is sharp and strong and takes some flavour and body away (I think), it doesnÂ’t work for me that well. Slight disappointment after Brunch weasel.
Old rating. All around solid stout. Strong black pour. Espresso, dark chocolate, roast, slightly chewy, full bodied and lightly sweet. Great.

Pitch black with a huge dark brown head. Coffee, nuts, roasted malt, dark chocolate. A little bitter with a nice roasted coffee aftertaste. Light body, lively carbonation, long bitter finish.

33cl bottle bought at cerveteca bar in Lisbon. It pours a pitch black colour with a large thick and creamy tan head that persists well. Aroma is sweet, coffee espresso, dark chocolate, milk, cereals from the oats and dark fruit. Taste is sweet from the brown sugar, roasted nuts, powerful dark chocolate, oats and other cereals, and a heavy milky chocolate feel. It has a medium to full body, with low carbonation and a bitter taste at the end that lingers for a while. Definitely one of, if not the best, regular stout that I ever tasted. Its flavour is not that complex compared to other stouts that I tried, but this stout was the one that I enjoyed the most.

33cl bottle at home. Pitch black with a medium beige head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Sweet and bitter tones. Coffee, dark chocolate, raisin, brown sugar and some spices. A tasty dark brew.

Black pour with a thin tan head, low carbonation. Sweet, coffee and cocoa smell, coffee dominates but in a good way, not a shitty instant coffee way. Taste is milky coffee, again like a good coffee, sweetish, long coffee bitterness. Like this one a lot.
What others have said but more dilute with more plain vhocolste and a medium soft roast. Nice looking black glossy beer with a rich glossy deep tan head.
Deep, black colour with nice beige head. Sweet, coffe aroma with some ash, chocolate and oatmeal notes. Sweet and sour taste, roasted notes, chocolate, coffee.

330 ml bottle. Chocolate smell with smoked coffe. Deep dark color with low brown head. Incredibly bitter taste, itÂ’s like a very charged coffee, very complex on the mouth. It is a not for everybody beer, the taste is very different.

Black pour from 12oz bottle at home. Hardly any head at all. Sweet, sugary, milk, cocoa, and vanilla aromas. Taste is coffee heavy, mild chocaolate notes, and a little milky. It is pretty damn tasty.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 Butelka, warka... yyy... nie moge znalezc daty waznosci. Na kapslu nie ma. Wyglad klasa - piana co prawda wymaga agresywnego nalania, zeby byla, ale jest ladna, bardzo fajnie brudzi szklo, bardzo ciemna. Oczywisci redukuje sie blyskawicznie do obraczki. Jest lekko kwaskowate od slodow palonych pewnie, jest bardziej w strone wytrawna choc wcale nie jakos ekstremalnie, kawa na jezyku bardziej mi sie kojarzy z robusta niz z arabica. Aroma is roasted coffee beans, light creaminess, espresso and light malts. Slight earthiness and chocolate. Taste is a well rounded roasty body with heavy coffee presence with subtle bitterness. Appearance is a black body with a thin pearl head that retains fairly poorly.
Sa me soule demettre 150 putain de caractÃ¨re pour dÃ©crire une biÃ¨re indescriptible!!

Tap @ Basement Beer Bar. Aroma of burnt malts, dark bitter chocolate and coffee. Black colour with small tan head, none lasting. More aroma in taste, malt bitterness, moderate sweetness. Full body, smooth texture,soft carbonation, burnt malt bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2015 Bottle bought at Geers. Had this numerous times, this is my go to stout. Always delivers. 7,5 ABV but what a god damn coffee, chocolate bomb. Full dark with a brown head. Aroma is espresso, chocolate, caramel. Taste is coffee, chocolate, malts and light bitterness.

0,33 l butelka. Czarny jak smoÅ‚a z ciemnobeÅ¼owÄ… pianÄ…. OczekiwaÅ‚em od tego piwa chyba zbyt duÅ¼o. Kawa, kawa, kawa. 
Piwo ewidentnie nie dla mnie.
Deep brown to black color, tiny brown head. Coffee nose, brown sugar, fruity, light sour notes. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dry finish, hint of fruit. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
33cl bottle. ThatÂ’s a perfect "breakfast" stout. Beautiful at sight and great for the nose, has a strong character that shows its class and its coffee element prominently.

Pours a super dark brown with a brown ring. The smell is dark roast, coffee, molasses. The taste is coffee, some grounds, caramell ending with roast and bitterness. Medium body, a little hollow with fine carbonation.

Un nez bien appÃ©tissant de cafÃ© et de chocolat : on a clairement Ã  faire Ã  une bonne stout! Un petite mousse surplombe un liquide typiquement foncÃ©. Au goÃ»t cÂ’est vraiment trÃ¨s rÃ©ussi. Le cafÃ© et les autres notes torrÃ©fiÃ©es se marient parfaitement. Un dÃ©jeuner? PlutÃ´t un succulent dessert je dirais!
