Bottle at a tasting at Butler's place. Bottle was a gusher. Half the bottle wasted. Poured dark brown with entire glass of foam. Idiots. After foam went down color was dark brown. Aroma is lots of coffee. Somewhat boozy. Very very disappointing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black with a cream chocolate head and with some lacing too. Medium/Full body with medium/slow carbonation. ItÂ’s really a breakfast beer thank to the expresso coffe and little snack in the form of cocholate. I love this smoked aromas mixed with dry fruits. Thanks Mikkeller to the tasteorgasm!
Kolsvart med stort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar massor med kaffe och choklad. Lite rÃ¶kig. Mycket kaffebeska som stannar lÃ¤nge!

Bottle. Deep dark brown, smallish beige head, medium lacing. Amazing aroma, coffee, chocolate and malt on a faintly sour background - wild cherries? Medium body, taste and texture pure espresso, long lasting. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heavy, black beer with a short lived tan head. Aromas of roasted malts and black coffee. Thick, oily mouthfeel, with strong flavours of roasted black coffee, dark chocolate and lingering creaminess. Very good indeed, if not a bit on the rich side for me.

Poured into a teku showing half a finger of latte colored foam that quickly dissipates and pours black, oily, and thick. 

The nose shows very subtle but heavily roasted coffee beans. 

The palate is thick, very smooth, somewhat foamy with very light carbonation. The first impression shows a lot of black coffee forwardness with a slight tartness akin to most coffee. Unfortunately it is not balanced as the flavor does not continue to the finish. As with the Weasel, most of the bitterness comes from the hops rather than having the coffee/espresso finish one might expect. The finish does show some subtle hints of the coffee/espresso but not overt.

Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast has a thin, cream-colored head, a black appearance, and a few splotchy lacing specks left behind on the glass. The aroma is of dark, slightly turned fruit, spinach, coffee, and dark-roasted barley malt. Taste is of powdery coffee, sweet black bread, char, and mellow bitterness. Mouthfeel is heavy and slightly oily. Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast finishes powdery and medium bitter. RJT

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Black colour with nice brown head that disappear quickly. Nice smoked coffee nose and good coffee taste. A bit disappointed on the flavours, a little bit weak to my taste. Nice bitterness, a very good stout but I had better ones lately ;)

Great taste with coffee and chocolate. 
With a slight hint of smoke. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours black with minimal brown head, earthly coffee aroma with a blend of chocolate and slight licorice. The smell is sweet but the taste is medium bitter and sour. It is a medium body, thin texture and average carbonation. Overall its a complex beer with a lasting aftertaste comparable to a gourmet coffee experience. Anyone with a palate for this kind of thing would find it enjoyable. Thank you Mikkeller.
Mycket chocklad i aromen viss beska med kaffe och chocklad i smaken. BrÃ¤nda kaffebÃ¶nor i eftersmaken.

Pours black with a mocha-brown head which is quite large initially but then recedes to a number of bubbly patches. Aroma roast malts, coffee and slight liquorice. Taste is coffee, roast malts, slightly woody and a hint of vanilla/oat sweetness. Medium to thick mouthfeel.

Bottles pours a dark brown, near black, one finger tan head that fades to a ring. Aromas of coffee, oats, toffee, chocolate and roasted nut. Taste is iced coffee with chocolate bearing down. Nice thick body lets the flavors stick to the palate. Wishing their was a bit more depth to the chocolate but, hey, itÂ’s a coffee beer! Nice finish with deep oat, cereal, nuttiness pushing the coffee bitterness back to the middle. Very nice beer!

black, cloudy, rocky head, brown foamPowerful aroma with a much more intense punch from the coffee. IÂ’m not getting as much roasted aroma on this beer, but it might be that the coffee is overpowering some of the other less intense aromas.

Flavor

As with the aroma the coffee is very intense and numbs the other flavors. IÂ’m picking up hints of chocolate, roasted malts and vanilla. There is also a noticeable grassy hoppy flavor present. Even if the coffee flavor is quite intense it does not ruin the beer at all. It works really well!

The carbonation level is higher which makes the mouth feel of the beer less smooth. Personally I would prefer lesser carbonation.

Finish

Very long finish and a lot more bitter than the one brewed at NÃ¸gne Ã˜. There is a slight hint of alcohol present as well.

Blackie Lawless color with a fine beige head. Nice lacing. Coffee, chocolate and roasted aroma. Medium to full body. Fine balance between sweetness and bitterness. Soft carbonation. Lots of coffee in the flavor. Also chocolate and roasted. More imperial stout than some other. Nice tasty buddy.[Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop in Copenhagen, Denmark]
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 How: Bottle. Appearance: Pitch black with a medium sized tanned head. Aroma: coffee. burned caramel, chocolate, dried fruits and cherries. almost a full body, soft carboantion.
A great stout, full of metallic aromas, and a creamy mouthfeel. Not quite brave enough to have it with breakfast, but would love to.
Poured from bottle thank you Willrunforbeer. Aromas of caramel, smoke and coffee. Pours dark chocolate color with a thin lace head. Smooth mouth feel with hints of smoke and a slight spice finish.
Bomber brewed at Nogne 0. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is spent coffee grinds, licorice, smoke. Flavor is dark chocolate and dark roasted coffee. Finish is black coffee bitterness.
Excellent oatmeal stout. A little coffee, a little sweetness, excellent body and flavor
Kaffee, dunkle Schokolade, Kakao. Recht bitter, recht trocken, sehr edler Kaffee, etwas dunkle FrÃ¼chte, viel Kakaobitterkeit.

Pours a dark black with a medium cocoa head that dissipates quickly with some lacing. Aroma is smokey bacon and coffee. Taste is black coffee, chicory with a hint of smoke. A good beer for breakfast as the name suggests.

Christmas beer 6. Bottle thanks to richthevillan, cheers mate. Black beer with medium tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts and a hint of dark chocolate. Taste is roast coffee, dark fruit, some dry bitterness and a hint of licorice. Medium bodied. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Carlens kvater bottle 33cl. Black pour tan head, nose is coffee, taste is coffee. 

Sample c4. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of coffee, choko, roast, licorice. Taste is heavy coffee, licorice, sweet malts, light vanilla notes. Very good.

Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast is a hearty brew with the taste of oats. Aroma is sweet with a hint of smoke. Taste is malty with notes of oats, chocolate and coffee. The smoke is not real apparent in the beginning, but builds as the glass goes down -- very nice. Beer Geer Breakfast will have you wanting more at breakfast or any other time!

Bottle at home, 24th December 14. Pours elegant black, tan head, that dissipates. Aroma is complex, liquorice, coffee, chocolate, tar, raisins. Taste is smooth, luxurious, in harmony with a soft light carbonation, which is perfect. Coffee, liquorice, roasted malts, slight molasses. Excellent Stout, worthy of the status

Pours a deep brown, with little to no opacity. Quickly dissipating, caramel head with minimal lacing. Aroma is delicious french roast and the slightest hint of milk chocolate. Comes on strong with bitter dark roast and bacon burnt black. Moderately dry on the palate, and a very light mouthfeel with moderate to mid-plus carbonation. Back-to-back-to-back with FBS and Wake-N-Bake. Gotta give it to the WNB.

Bottle 33 cl. Very dark brown to black beverage. High brown foam which rapidly decreases. The aroma of chocolate, raisins and brown sugar. Clear dry taste of dark roasted coffee, cocoa and vanilla. Slightly fuzzy feeling in the mouth.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 Dark brown body with a thin brown head. Aroma is roasted malt,  dark fruits, coffee, dark bitter chocolate. Taste is medium to heavy bitter, light sweet, balanced. Bitter finish.
Pours a dark, dark brown with plenty of khaki colored head. Coffee, strong coffee and chocolate on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more coffee and some roasted malt.

Bottle. Pours black with thick creamy beige head. Aroma is a great mix of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, oatmeal and liquorice. Taste is mostly about coffee (little lacks of balance here). Bitterness is intense. Full bodied beer.
Bomber, black pour tan head, nose is coffee, taste is coffee. Super rich chocolate, intense and awesome

330ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with brown head. Burnt malty aroma, smokey, coffee and chocolate. Sweet and bitter taste like the aroma, smoked coffee chocolate burnt malty. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Cette biÃ¨re est dÂ’un noir dÂ’encre et coiffÃ©e dÂ’une mousse brune dense. Au nez, une amertume marquÃ©e combinÃ©e Ã  des notes de cafÃ© brÃ»lÃ© et de malt rÃ´ti domine fiÃ¨rement. En bouche, peu de surprise: torrÃ©faction sans complexitÃ© mÃªlÃ©e d.une pointe dÂ’aciditÃ©. On a vraiment lÂ’impression dÂ’avoir laissÃ© la cafetiÃ¨re fonctionner trop longtemps sur le comptoir.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, oats, tons of coffee, some smoke, hoppy notes. Flavour is light sweet with an amazingly bitter roasty finish. Smooth and extremely well-balanced. This is a great beer.

Au nez, on sent le caramel, l'alcool et la torrÃ©faction. Je ne saurais l'expliquer, mais j'ai aussi l'impression de sentir un pot de beans qui a longuement mijotÃ©! En bouche, on a un bon goÃ»t d'avoine et de grains. L'alcool est toujours prÃ©sente accompagnÃ©e d'une amertume modÃ©rÃ©e. En finale, notre bouche est enveloppÃ©e par un lÃ©ger goÃ»t de cafÃ© amer qui s'estompe tranquillement. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Great malty coffee aroma. No head at all. Pours an opaque brown tinted black. Drinks very smoothly.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 Bottle from De Hopduvel, Gent, Belgium. Oat Stout with Coffee. Well balanced but I had higher expactations from this beer :-) Brunch Weasel version is way better (Imperial Russian Stout from Emelisse is still better than this one too)
Dark black. Dark khaki head. Kind of creamy. Some cola flavors. Very dark roasted coffee.

This bottle is a few years old. The aroma is malt, caramel, a little chocolate and coffee. Pours black with caramel brown head, mostly diminishing, good lacing. The taste is bitter and long. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation average and the finish bitter. Flavors of coffee very good. SUCKS that we canÂ’t get Mikkeller in Michigan any more!

Interessante stout brassata nel birrificio Lervig dalla mano di Mikkeller. Si presenta con colore oscuro e schiuma poco persistente. Al naso note di arrosto, torrefatto e caffÃ¨. In bocca sorprende per la leggerezza ed intensitÃ  del sapore, il corpo medio e la bilanciatura tendenzialmente amara. Molto buona questa "Breakfast" in fatti il nome Ã¨ giusto, perfetta per la colazione o dessert!!

Black color and a quite dark brown head. Roasted, sweet and slightly smokey aroma of oats, dark malts, coffee, some chocolate and a bit of hops. Tastewise loads of very bitter coffee, chocolate, liqorice. Not very sweet but some fruitiness nontheless. Good beer.

Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a clear dark mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is dry smoky roasted malt. The flavour is moderate to strong bitter with a big roasty liqourice coffee alcoholic bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. DidnÂ’t really get the chocolate at all, just lots of roasty liqourice bitter.
I was not aware of what i was drinking, so i was not biased about it. Indeed its very pleasant, but its not the best beer out there. Nice roasted malt, full taste and long aftertaste.

BOTTLE 33CL. Starts with a huge cold cofeee aroma, very roasty, chocolate, aniseed and a touch of alcohol. The coffee gradually goes away, leaving room for sweeter aroma - chocolate, coffee liquor. The taste is also full of coffee and chocolate, but still is more straight forward that he aroma. Some citrus hops in the finish. Medium body.
Imperial stout travolgente e decisa, dal gusto ricco, appagante, con una caffettositÃ  quasi mistica. Da bere e ribere e ribere...

Very nice smoky, coffee flavor. One of the better Oatmeal Stouts out there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(330ml bottle @ PitcherÂ’s, LinkÃ¶ping, Nov 11 2014) Pours black with basically no head. Great nose of dark malts, toasted or lightly burnt wood (not ashy), medium/dark roast coffee, some dark chocolate with hints of sweetness, soy is light but detectable. On the palate, cold pressed coffee, a little raw cane sugar sweetness at first, quickly fades. Some dry dark chocolate joins the coffee in the middle, a bit of dark malt character. Roast quite present from both coffee and malt, but it is not overpoweringly burnt, just nice and dry. Oat character helps support that dryness from the middle on. Lightly woody, but not in the barrel sense. Medium-full slick body with light prickly carb. Long finish of coffee and roast, dry with no booze. I really love the dry, smooth coffee-driven character of this beer, so rich and flavourful but nowhere close to cloying and sweet. Perfect for breakfast!
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Pitch black color, small brownish head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and roast. Full body, soft carbonation. Brutally tasty, creamy, smooth. Insanely good.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with moderate tan head. Aromas of creamy coffee, coconut, chicory, and roasted malts. Flavors are rich and similar with additional dry dark chocolate. Smooth and dry. Really defines this type of Scandanavian Stout.
Bottle 0,33l, bought at Svijet Piva in Zagreb (Croatia). Thick dark liquid with ocher head. Full body, light carbonation. A bit of smoke in aroma, taste of coffee, full and beautiful. Great one.

zwart met schuimige fijne bruine kraag. aroma is heerlijk, volmoutig, chocolade, koffie, gebrande en geroosterde mouten alsmede wat vanille. smaken zijn matig zoet, matig bitter, licht zuurtje, zeer sterk, bittere donkere chocolade, sterke koffie, laurier, medium body, romig van textuur, lage co2. afdronk wat droog,

Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it thick dark color with small white head.Good texture perfect.Taste and aroma of roasted malt, brown sugar, roasted coffee, spices.Perfect balancedvery drinkable. What to say percetion.My 500th rating.
Bottle 33cl. Pours dark black with a tiny brown head that fades fast. Roasty, nuts, coffee. Medium sweetness with a nice bitterness from the coffee.

Bottle. Pours black and thick like used motor oil. Creme colored head with oat-like aroma and mild carbonation. Coffee flavor and chocolate bitterness. Substantial mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Clapton Craft, recommended by the staff. Strong espresso, dark chocolate, licorice, toasty burnt malt and dark fruit. Awesomely dark, superbly smoky. Pretty amazing.
Quite a lot of coffee a little hoppy and bitter too with a substantial acid bite Andy thinks alright prolly the hops covering the coffee. So expensive tho so Julie gives 3.8

cÂ’est une stout dÂ’avoine de chez Mikkeller, brassÃ© avec du cafÃ©, pas vraiment fait pour se dÃ©saltÃ©rer..pour le breakfast, oui, mais seulement si tu viens de passer la nuit Ã  picoler..si tu te sers Ã§a au rÃ©veil, profites-en pour appeller le service dÂ’addictologie le plus proche...pour lÂ’aspect, voir photo. Au nez, on est sur du cafÃ© evidement, chocolat noir, cacao, vanille et ptit cotÃ© fumÃ©.. En bouche, cÂ’est pareil, cafÃ©, cafÃ©, cafÃ©, tabac, chocolat noir, ca remplit le palais,cÂ’est Ã©quilibrÃ© , et lÂ’amertume arrive , crescendo, et sÂ’installe, tranquille, cÂ’est une belle rÃ©ussite

Pitch black colour. It looks like old oil engine. Head is big and stable, nice lacing too. Aroma is not very intensive (the weakest side of beer) dominated by coffee, roasted malts with hint of vanilla, smoke and citrus hoppiness. Taste is medium to heavy sweet , medium bitter and light to medium sour. ItÂ’s taste like cold espresso with brown sugar and citrus. Very rich and complex stuff. Very long medium bitter and sour finish. Coffee note is sensible during few minutes after last sip. Full body. Soft carbonation. Fantastic stout, but I wish it could had stronger aroma.

I was holding onto this for a while and accidentally freeze distilled it in the back of the fridge. But I can attest that it hides the alcohol well even at a higher ABV. The oatmeal seems to lend a nice smoothness that blends into the coffee. Possibly the best incorporation of coffee IÂ’ve tried -- itÂ’s almost part of the malt profile and has only a little bitterness in the back. Not too sweet. Like drinking a good iced coffee, only thicker. Superb. Wish I hadnÂ’t left a few ounces as an ice sphere.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color negro. Sabor a cafe, malta tostada, ligeramente a chocolate, dulce.

Poured a black colour with toffee head. Strong aroma of coffee with a faint note of alcohol. Flavor was rich with coffee, oat, and eventual bitterness. Heavy mouthfeel and with an intense bite. Good porter, but a harsh brew to drink leisurely.
Nice fresh aroma, a bit citrusy on the nose. Fresh arabica coffee on the palate with hints of dark chocolate.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, light muscovado, raisins and figs. Taste is roasty coffee and dark chocolate, light nuts and smoke. Body is medium rich and smooth with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn (Â€ 4,20), Oct 2014. Pours black with a thick dark tan head that laces and retains nicely. Wonderful aroma of roasted malts, coffee, bitter chocolate and spicy citrusy hops... more as it warms, accompanying with some booziness. Taste is is roasty and chocolaty sweet at first, but that is quickly buried in the thick and resinous bitterness of Centennial and Cascade. Finishes bitter with returning roastiness, and soothing alcoholic warmth. Soft palate with very little carbonation, and a slick, somewhat oily mouthfeel. Near perfect.

Great classic stout aroma with a bit more coffee than usual. Appearance is just my kind of beer: pitch black with dark-brown foam. Flavor is excellent, again the coffee comes through. Mouthfeel nice and rough (like a good porter). Overall one of the best oat-based stouts IÂ’ve had.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Smell of chocolate. Taste of chocolate, roasted, coffee. Tasty and malty. Would be interesting to try a Beer Geek Break from Lervig and one from NÃ¶gne Ã– at the same time.
On sample. Black with brown two finger head. Oat, coffee and boozy aroma. Oat and roasted coffee aroma. Nice bitter finish.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Pitch black, brown foamy head. Aroma of smoked malt, coffee and some chocolate. Alcohol is overpowering, some coffee coming through. Tasty but not as smooth as it could be but still excellent.

A - dark molasses black brown, dark quickly vanishing to fine lacy head
A - wood, meat, smokey, fireplace, clove
T - woody smoked taste finish with tobacco flavor
P - thin start to full finish thin oily texture
O - a manly drink with rough edge and rich flavor but not quite my cup of tea
Strong burn smell is impressive. Very special taste and strong aroma. Not my style.

Bottle, 500ml. A dark beer with a big foamy head. Aroma is of alcohol, coffee and roasted malt. Taste is sweet and has a smoked character. There is some carbonation and astringency. Somewhat dense and oily. Aftertaste reminds me of coffee and alcohol.

Bottle, 500ml. Opaque black with a frothy/creamy brown head. Subtle aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dried fruits and alcohol. Robust and oily, with moderate carbonation. Sweet and low on bitterness, with a rich smoothness and deep alcohol and coffee finish. Very pleasant, but I think the Mikkeller beers brewed in Belgium are superior to the ones brewed in Norway!

Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast
Bottle to pint glass. The pour is super dark brown with a big cola head. The aroma is coffee and booze and chocolate and awesome. The flavor is coffee and bittersweet chocolate upfront with a creamy lactose sugar backend. There's hops as well but it's pretty well balanced. The finish is smooth and viscous. Overall a dope beer I'm glad I got to try.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Chocolate, toffee, coffee, stale coffee finish. Dry across palate and clean finish. Great beer thatÂ’s is definitely well balanced and delicious.

Bottle (from the Bottle Shop in Bratislava); pours nearly black with a thin brown head; aroma is mostly chocolate, with some roasted coffee and oats; taste is roasted malt with a little sweetness with chocolate and oats, then the coffee brings a little bit of bitterness; semi-dry finish; excellent stout that is well balanced and easy to drink.

12 oz bottle from Whole Foods. Pours a near black with light passing as maroon when backlit. The beige head fades to the edge and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is chocolate malt, roasted grain, bakerÂ’s chocolate. Flavor is full and intense - bittersweet chocolate with roasted coffee and grain. Malt, oat and slight hop bitterness. Solid.

Dark brown body with beautiful brown coffee-like head. Dark chocolate, coffee,hops. Sweetness followed by heavy bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel.Great balanced beer, very espresso like, overall, delightful.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Pitch black, huge brown head. Smoked aroma, coffee, lots of dark chocolate and cocoa. Strong coffee kick, heavy coffee-like bitterness, but also some notes of grassy hops. Full body, soft carbonation. Creamy texture. Extremely long coffee finish. Another marvelous Mikkeller. (Svijet piva 0,33l bottle)

Bottle from Bottledog, KingÂ’s Cross. Pours inky black with a creamy tan head. The taste is rich and bitter with nice roast notes. Great aftertaste with coffee and chocolate. ThereÂ’s quite a bit of hop flavour in there too with some pine notes. Really good beer.

Bottle from systembolaget. Aroma has a sweet scent of coffee and some chocolates. Pours solid black with a nice creamy brown head. Taste is a very nice mixture of coffee, chocolates and vanilla. Palate is oily and sticks nicely to the tongue. Overall a really solid beer and a nice drink which delivers nicely.
Perfect oatmeal stout! Insanely aromatic (coffee, cakes, chocolate), hoppy, dry, perfect. Nice head, awesome lacing, great drinkability. THE BEST OATMEAL STOUT IN THE UNIVERSE!

Overall I was disappointed with this beer. At$10 for 11 oz bottle I expected to get blown away. I did not. Aroma was coffee and chocolate. Not much coffee taste. Mostly dark chocolate with a bitter finish.

Pours black with a little light brown head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, coffee, earthy, and sweet wood. Flavor is strong roasted coffee and alcohol with a bitter bite to finish it off. The coffee flavor stays with you throughout.

Bottle bought in Denmark, pours near black with a tan crema, nose is leather, tobacco, coffee, and a faint tart wineyness. Rich, heavy and coffee infused, with dark cocoa, faint pepper and earth, and a light dry bitterness. IÂ’d be happier with it though if there wasnÂ’t an inch of sludge in the bottom of the bottle.

Bottle obtained in a trade. Pours dark black with a small bubbly head. Nose is stale coffee and dark fruit. Flavor follows with dark chocolate, oats, and a lot of bitter stale coffee. Medium mouthfeel, perhaps on the watery side for this style of beer. Not great.

Bottle. Pours opaque brownish black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, soy sauce, mint, orange, grapefruit, dried flowers, hints ammonium chloride. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet and light acidic. Body is creamy with medium-soft carbonation. Finish is long and medium bitter sweet with notes of malt, brown sugar, sweet licorice, dark dried fruits (prunes, dates, raisins), oat meal and soy sauce. Very rich and well balanced, but I didnÂ’t find the coffee?!

Bottle. Black with a lovely creamy brown head. The aroma is full and rich, with cocoa, coffee, light smoke, oats, and a berry note. The flavour is just lightly sweet and very smooth, with cocoa, coffee, molasses, finishing very bitter like burnt malts. The body is medium, with a very silky mouthfeel. Really good although I like the brunch weasel so much I would always take it over this.

330ml bottle. Label says brewed and bottled at Lervig Aktiebryggeri, Norway. Opaque black color with a small bubbly tan head that dissipates quickly. Rich espresso-like roasted malt nose has hints of tobacco and burnt wood. Intense roasted malt flavor with more espresso coffee and charred wood. Silky and bitter with slight oat notes and minimal carbonation. As oatmeal stouts go, this is dry and bitter with big coffee flavor. Hops come in late in finish. This is special. Hard to find and pricy at $8.00 for a 330 ml bottle.

Keg at BD ShepBush. Black pour, moderate tan head, recedes but remains, very little lacing. Aroma strongly of coffee, plus some cocoa and roasted malt. Tastes of sweet chocolate, toffee caramel, then big roasted malt and coffee hit, and dry ashiness, plus distinct hop bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture, moderate carb. Been waiting a while to try this, glad to have done so.
Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are coffee, dark chocolate, and roasted malts.

Keg at BD Sheps Bush, finally caught up on rating this, 27/08/14.
Pitch black with a well appointed dirty tan covering that dissipates then retains as a smaller being.
Nose is roast malt, light smoke, liqourice, spice, earthy cocoa rub, coffee, hoppy backnotes.
Taste comprises chocolate, vanilla, toffee fudge, coffee, bitter roastings, bitter chocoalte sprinkle.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close laced with earthy hop bitterness and burnt roast.
Solid stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On tap at House of 1000 Beers. Roasted nose with coffee, woody, molasses and alcohol. Rich aroma. Dark black opaque with thin tan head. Oily body with medium-high carbonation. Starts dry with cherry wood and oak. Coffee. Very dry with big bitter notes. A bitter finish with lingering bitter after and warming. A bit harsh.

The beer is almost perfect in every way. Has only one tiny downside, which is aroma. It is really great but very tiny, very small. ItÂ’s hard to get it. Every other thing is awesome. It looks amazing, gives this super mouth feeling. But first of all - itÂ’s taste. This coffee - just wow. Amazing coffee taste. ItÂ’s so smooth, so velvety, so silky. IÂ’m just speechless.

Bottle from Berlin Bier Shop. Pout is jet black with a caramel head, aroma is intense coffee and caramel. Taste is coffee, malty, with bitterness towards the long bitter finish, light-bodied with soft carbonation. Classy and nicely balanced, but could be bolder

Sampled on draft at Hou Thou this beer poured a very dark black color with a medium sized foamy brown head that left decent lacing. The aroma was bitter wood, smoke and brewed coffee. The flavor was bitter licorice, wood, perfume, rose water, violet, a bit of coffee and charcoal. Very long finish of perfume, violet and charcoal. Medium body. Pretty awful.

Bottle 0,33L. Thanks to Kita for sharing. Murky, black colour with large, creamy, light brown head, that settle down soon. Aroma of coffe and chocolate. Taste starts light bitter/light acidic loaded withblack coffee, aftertaste is heavy bitter. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden behind coffee taste. Have this one in the morning after breakfast.

12oz bottle, Lervig Aktiebryggeri version... Aged about 1 year. Pours oil slick black with thin med brown head. Aroma is burnt coffee, bitter chocolate, booze, black licorice, smoke, heavily roasted / burnt malt, roasted oats. Flavor is smokey burnt malt, bitter coffee & aged / off hop flavor, some ash/tar, bitter coffee grinds and hops on the finish. Very complex flavor and thick mouthfeel, bitter throughout from many sources (smoke, coffee, chocolate, hop).. Interested to try this fresh, not totally blown away aged, hop profile clearly evolved / seemed off.

12oz Bottle poured into a tulip -- An opaque black beer with a tan/brown thin head. Aroma is roast coffee, roasted malts, and burnt molasses. Flavor is mild coffee, with some sweetness from malt with a twang of vanilla, and then finishes roasty; coffee and malt roastiness. I really should have drank this earlier in the day and not right before dinner. Oh well, at least I have a second bottle.

Tap at brewdog, shepherds bush. Pours very dark brown/black. Dusty, light soy, dried meat aroma. Medium body, light to medium carbonation. Coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, teriyaki, light soy, brown toast, slight hint of marmite, wood, light treacle, lemon... Fairly dry. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piwo butelkowe. W aromacie kawa i czekolada, lekkie nuty Å›liwek. Kolor czarna smoÅ‚a nieprzejrzysta z Å›redniÄ… ale kremowÄ… zostajÄ…cÄ… do ostatniego Å‚yka pianÄ…. W smaku sÅ‚odycz czekolady, specyficzna kawowa goryczka przypominajÄ…ca espresso oraz cierpkoÅ›Ä‡ i gÄ™stoÅ›Ä‡ od pÅ‚atkÃ³w owsianych czyniÄ… z tego piwa nie lada przysmak. Wysycenie niskie do zerowego. Åšwietny stout.

Pours pitch black, oily, with brown, short head that stays in form of a ring around the glass to the end. Aroma of sweet dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Medium body and soft carbonation, the beer sticks to your mouth and stays there for a while. Taste is mostly coffee and roastiness, a bit sweet, with a long, bitter finish that stays in your mouth long after you finish your beer. Bitterness is a mix between roastiness and hops. Good beer, quite complex, gives you something to remember. Not that far away from some of the lighter imperial stouts.

A very nice beer that tastes of porridge and coffee so would go very well with breakfast. Its not very carbonated and I didnÂ’t notice much lacing or head on it. Its a shame I had the Texas Ranger before it as that overshadowed this one. Should have been the other way round. bottle at bottle shop.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is roast coffee, chocolate, taste is rich chocolate, oaty, roasted, coffee, dry, bitter.
Draft at HOTB. Nice vanilla, expresso bean notes. Medium body. Creamy texture. Smooth roasted malt with coffee bean and some cocoa. Pretty good but IÂ’ve had better. A bit overpriced.
A black beer with a small brown head. The aroma is chocolate and coffee with fig and oat. The flavor is roated malt and coffee, fairly bitter.

Bottle, best before 07-01-19. Appearance is pitch black, no light escaping at all, completely opaque. Half a finger light brown head which fades away to leave a foam around the edge. Aroma- chocolate, a bit fudgy, milk chocolate particularly, smooth coffee, and you can almost smell the oats. Hints of blackcurrant and liquorice, roasted malts. Smells rich. Taste- big roasted malts. Perfect balance between coffee and chocolate. Starts more milky then becomes bitter- espresso, hop bitterness. Excellent mouthfeel- quite full and clingy. A bit of body, and a lasting bitter finish. Delicious stuff.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Dark roasted malty taste, dark chocolate, black coffee, hops. Oily texture. Creamy mouthfeel. Slight bitter finish of coffee. Nice and tasty.

Very chocolate and slightly sweet aroma. Very dark brown color with a brownish offwhite head that hangs around poured into a wine glass. Surprisingly light mouth feel with some carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet but mostly dark chocolate and oatmeal. Lingering bitter dark chocolate after taste. Not very malty or smooth. Its an interesting beer, but I canÂ’t imagine how it would pair with other flavors.

Very nice balance between malt & dry, coffee flavors. Although IÂ’m rating quite high, IÂ’ve had better coffee stouts, but this is done quite well. Will I pay $6 / bottle again??? Hell no. Serving: 12oz bottle.

Bottle, 330 ml.
Coffee, chocolate in aroma, some smoky notes.
Black color with brown head. 
Start with light malt sweetness, that immediately became bitter - chocolate and roasted malt bitter. 
Medium body, avarage carbonation with very long bitter finish and little bit astringent...
Looks a bit disbalanced for me...Disappointed...

Sun-blocking color with slight mocha colored head after a slow bottle pour. Great oat and coffee roast taste with a finish begging for another sip. Saw high score after tasting and was not suprised. One of my favorites now. Off to search for more.

Bottle from Ales by Mail, brewed in Norway. Pours dark brown, nearly reddish black, foamy chocolate brown head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, red berries, leather, roast. ItÂ’s medium sweet and not very bitter until the finish, when roasted coffee beans linger a bit with some chocolate tempering it. Nice full body and warming. Great stuff.

Bottle, 0.33, shared with CanCrusher. Pours murky, almost black color with medium creamy brown head and good lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, white coffee and chocolate. Taste start with rich and heavily roasted sour malt, follows by strong coffee with well hidden alcohol and medium bitter finish. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation in palate. I am totally surprised as I can enjoy in beer made with coffee that I drink. And what is more, coffee beans were shitted by weird animal called civet :)

Najlepszy stout jaki miaÅ‚em okolicznoÅ›Ä‡ piÄ‡ - piana doÅ›Ä‡ krÃ³tka ale piÄ™kna, brÄ…zowa - aromat palony, sÅ‚odki czekoladowy i kawa, poza tym fajny drzewny zapach. W smaku goryczkowe, gorzka czekolada, kawa palona, delikatny karmel. Idealna oleista konsystencja, duÅ¼a pijalnoÅ›Ä‡ pomimo 7,5% alkohol niewyczuwalny - no zatem mam Å›niadanie o 3.30 w nocy :)

Pours opaque, almost jet black with small chocolate brown head into a Mikkeller glass. Sweet Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, treacle. Taste is much more bitter than the smell suggests, but sweet up front. Dark chocolate first, then the coffee kicks in hard, with a little bit of leather too. Lighter bodied than what I normally expect from an oatmeal stout but leaves a nice oily mouth coating. Fairly nicely balanced beer and very enjoyable.

Drunk at the end of OFF festival, katowice train station. we hid it in coffee cups. some security guards came over and were like HOHOHOHOOOO what have we here?? to a sleeping hipster. they gave him a bunch of shit and all the while we were sipping it in front of em. no fucks givennnnn

so the beer itself is awesome. pours thick and creamy, with sticky frothy head. intense coffee aroma, vanilla, slightly smoky too. the taste and feel were delicious. rich burned malty flavour of coffee and chocolate. good balance of bitter and sweet. low fizz and very creamy. probably my fav stout so far. cant wait to drink the bacon one now too

On tap @ Mikkeller, Bangkok. Pitch black, slim brown head. Nice light aroma of coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is beautifully rounded and soft with the mentioned aromaÂ’s as flavours, nicely bitter hoppy too. Dry, lingering aftertaste. Soft mouthfeel, low carbonation, good body.
149 SEK at Systembolaget for 750 ml). Powerful with taste of coffee and toasted malts. Not sure if I would like this for breakfast... Even if very good, not really worth the price.

Bottle into glass. Bought @ Centrala Piwna, PoznaÅ„. Smoky aroma, coffee, chocolate, roasty, bread. Dark, almost black liquid with rich, tan coloured head, very durable, great lacing. Taste slightly sweet, definitely not a bitter beer. Average carbonation, alcohol well hidden, roasty notes are felt on the palate, very drinkable. Medium-full body. Great beer overall. Could have had a bit more coffee in the aroma. Still: a classy stout.

btw...2000th rating of this beer :D

Dobre czarne z ciemno brazowa piana, niewielka ale jest. W zapachu kakao i czarna kawa. W smaku wytrawne palone i to mocno. Kawowe. Przypominalo Milk Stouta ale nie mialo wogole slodyczy, aczkolwiek slodowosc niewielka byla. Bogate tresciwe i zarazem lekkie i pijalne piwo. Nie tylko na sniadanie ale i do kolacji tez mozna polecac. Super alternatywa dla mocnej czarnej kawy, polecam nie tylko na sniadanie:)

Bottle from drinkshop.sk. Very dark brown color with thick long lasting beige head. Coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice,ash, hops in aroma. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, ash, piney hops, peat. Coffee bitter finish with touch of peat. Very tasty.

Combination of oatmeal stout and coffee stout, Danish but with an American touch and brewed with lots of different malts and grains. Creamy beige, stable head, colour black with a faint wine-red hue only visible under bright light. Assertive aroma, obviously very malty, a bit smoky, black coffee and coffee beans, tobacco, cacao powder, cassis, dates, medium dry sherry, caramel. Soft and rounded mouthfeel, in which the oatmeal is a subtle presence rendering a silky touch; dark fruits, profound chocolatey maltiness, smoky accent, late roasted and peppery hoppy bitterness, mouth-filling. I would have left out the smoked malt, otherwise a very complex and well-balanced stout.

Pitch black coloured (way >80 EBC) with a toffee coloured medium large head fading moderatley quick with lovely viscousity. Predominant aroma hitting the nose is coffee and roasted chocolate malt supported by earthy, toasted white bread, resin notes all topped by a whiff of floral-piny-ness (later tries to hide...). With a very little fizzyness the beer confesses flavours of espresso, bitter chocolate, roasted baguette and floral hints with a rather soft understated texture for a stout. One expects roasted bitterness which is of course very present but also chocolatey sweetness and light treacle notes develop which direct to a lovely full body . The finish is lasting balanced on the palate for a long while! Excellent beer!

330ml bottle from Brewdog shop. 
Small bubbly tan head disappears quickly, minimal lacing. Dark black body. Nose of coffee and dark berries. Flavour is dark berries, dark chocolate, oaty with loads of bitter coffee on the finish. Mouthfeel is full, rich and thick with little carbonation. Delicious.

33cl bottle. Pours black with a thick fluffy beige head. Smells of roasted malts, coffee, caramel, burnt sugar, some bitter chocolate. Taste is a lot of bitter coffee and roastiness. Very light smoked notes. Some hops, quite unusual for this style. Very good final bitter coffee aftertaste, dry finish. Excellent.

330 mml bottle tasted on 08/07/2014. Deep dark brown opaque colour with a medium beige head. Aroma is roasted and pour coffee. Taste is initially malty but afterwards is dominated by the black coffee and the roasted malts. Aftertaste is a little dry and medium bitter. Perfect carbonation for the style. Very well balanced beer. Next one please!

Pours black. Nice creamy brown head. Full of coffee. Great dark chocolate. Flavor has a perfect amount hoppiness. Smooth creamy medium body. Pleasant easy roastiness. Phenomenal aroma really stands out. This is how to use coffee in a beer.
Strong coffee, roast, sweet, chocolate. creamy. Reminds me of a rich library full of leather and mahogany. Chocolate, coffee, roasty taste. Slight sweetness.

33cl bottle
pours almost black with foamy beige head
aroma is bitter chocolate with coffee and malty grain
taste is a dry bitter chocolate coffee mocha with a long dry finish
big body oily 
A brilliant world class beer,one of the best stouts iv,e tasted
HIGHLY RECCOMENDED

Pours a very small dense/creamy browny head; jet fuel/deep black opaque colour. Wrapping and super roasty aroma: smells smoked malts, coffee beans, dark cocoa, licorice, wood, bit herbal and with a small hint of vanilla and cinammon. Really intense and nice! Tastes initially malty, roasted, dark chocolate, slightly spiced; afterwards licorice, coffee, oatmeal, and veggies with a very nice refreshing hop piny prensece/finish; some tobacco notes. Extremly long, evolving, and delicious aftertaste, medium bitter but never too much invasive; bit dry palate. Awesome creamy/thick texture, low to average carbonation. Very complex and alive through every sip, without doubt one of the best stouts IÂ’ve ever tasted

Bottle. Pours a deep, dark black/brown with a two-finger medium brown head. Prominent roasted coffee, toasted oat and hop aromas. The taste is at first somewhat sweet and moves into a more pronounced, bitter dark roast coffee and dark chocolate body with hints of smoke, oats and hops along the way. The finish is long-lasting, bitter and somewhat burnt. In all a very smooth, moderately robust body with a strong aftertaste. Reminiscent of a French Roast coffee complete with the chocolate on the side.
Boom, that's a good breakfast. Pours thick black with a dark chocolate head. Super smooth mouth, tad sour very bitter. Good balanced coffee flavor.
Great beer. Aromas of chocolate and vanilla, touch of smoke.Full marks for me.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Roastiness, smoke, coffeee. Very dry for a stout, loads of roastiness, but a very light body, and yet again very dry. Coffee is the most dominant flavour, I think some lactose and added body would make this beer better, or maybe I donÂ’t think a 7.5% stout can be great, but I prefer the Texas Ranger...

Bottle. Pours jet black with nice beige head which disappears quite quickly. Aroma: dark chocolate, coffee, roasty, dried fruits, plum, very good. Taste: great coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Maybe some smoky notes. Medium body, low carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste.Good drinkability.
On tap at Mikkeller bar. Deep dark with thick creamy brown head. Lots of coffee aromas roasted malts, sweet full-bodied mouthfeel, dry bitter finish.

deep dark colour, moderate, creamy dark brown head; aroma of coffee, hints of chocolate, ash, vanilla and smoked woods; taste of roasted coffee, and hints of smoke, maybe ash - much less complex than expected based on the aroma; long lasting roasted bitter aftertaste; dry mouthfeel;good, though a bit less complex stout than I expected

Batch 756 bottle from 2012, enjoyed at vacation. Robust and balanced dark color with a solid enduring head. Notes of peat, coffee, wood, barley and sweetness. Thoroughly enjoyable, but might be tuned with more chocolate to suite my tastes better. Must try the coffee used on its own once. Can be used as dessert companion to coffee-based ices with success.
JÃ³ sÃ¶r ez, de a Mikkeller fÃ©le felhozatalbÃ³l vannak szÃ¡momra kedvesebb sÃ¶rÃ¶k is. EttÅ‘l ez mÃ©g simÃ¡n egy harmadik helyre lÃ©phet nÃ¡lam a stout kategÃ³riÃ¡ban.

4 oz draft pour at ChurchKey. Black with tan head. Aromas of caramel, coffee, roast, oats, dark chocolate. Tastes of big roast, coffee, toasted oats, dark chocolate, caramel. Full body with a dry finish. Medium-light carbonation, thick oily mouthfeel. Love it.

Bottle to snifter while watching Brazil beat Croatia in the opening match, World Cup 2014. Black coffee color with thin tan head and lacing. Bold coffee, sweet toasted oats and vanilla bean. Dominant dark roast coffee flavors offset by creamy sweetness from the oats. Well balanced and tasty. Outstanding coffee stout.

Aroma: Chocolate, smoke, very pungent

Appearance: Dark brown head which leaves beautiful foam patterns along the glass, color is very dark brown

Taste: Dark chocolate, toasty coffee follows, rounds out with heavy bitterness

Palate: Mouth feel is creamy and not as thick as I expected. Flavors stick to the tongue for a awhile.

Overall: Excellent stout that brings espresso level bitterness to the table. Very similar to others offered by Mikkeller and Evil Twin in both aroma and flavor. Really enjoyed this one and happy to taste the beer that put Mikkeller on the map!

Very we'll done but too bitter for my palate. Interested in trying more from brewer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle->snifter. Deep brown with tan head, a: coffee, chocolate, roasty and a little smoky. T: bitter coffee and roasted chocolate malt. Nice lingering bitter cocoa aftertaste. Very nice.
DWF. MÃ¸rkt skum som vare. MÃ¸rk farge. Sjokolade kaffe. Drit god. Middels co2. Balansert.
Bottle. Poured black with thin tan head. Aroma of funky burnt coffee choc vanilla comes later. Light carb med bod. Charred burnt taste. Idk how they make coffee in Denmark but its aweful.

Flaska hemma - ganska trevlig doft. Silkeslen i munnen med tydliga brÃ¤nda toner, nÃ¥got kryddig och kaffe. Espresso skulle jag nog sÃ¤ga.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz poured in Pint, is dark black with a head that quickly settles into a brown lacing . Smells of coffee, roasted oats and the brewers yeast. Heavy mouth feel, thick with slight carbonation. 7.5 alcohol is not detected to make this heavy, just a thick stout. Strong roasted coffee flavor making it quite bitter; along with roasted oats, finishes dry and bitter. This is what IÂ’m ideally looking for in an Oatmeal Stout. For whatever reason, this also makes my stomach feel all nice and warm, and isnÂ’t sitting heavy whatsoever. Just an amazing beer, I held my breath buying this for $7 at Charlestown Wine & Spirts now IÂ’m gunna go back and try to buy them out. My highest recommendation, probably my favorite beer IÂ’ve ever had.
UPDATED: AUG 10, 2014 on tap. Black with tanned head. Smell is coffe chocolate and some bitterness. Taste is bitter coffee chocolate and roasted malt. A bit watery.

Tap at Roundhouse. Pitch black pour, fine thin tan head. Aroma is not as big as expected - coffee and general roastiness. Taste is roasted coffee and malts - again lighter than expected (and than the Weasel version of this beer). Surprisingly easy drinking for an imperial stout but not much other than coffee flavor. Could imagine actually drinking this alongside breakfast unlike the bigger versions. Preferred the Weasel version quite a bit.

pours thick black with a thin tan head. Rich oat flavor with a blend of coffee. Not too dark. A great breakfast stout. Very impressive. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours jet black with around half a finger of creamy brown or dark tan head. Pretty thick lacing on this one. Roasted and burnt malts on the nose, with notes of cream, chocolate, citrus, pine resin and a subtle hint of coffee. Malts taste more burnt than on the nose, an impart a large degree of bitterness. Other than that, taste of coffee, nuts, a slightly earthen note and a fair amount of hops, imparting sour notes predominantly. Chocolate isnÂ’t quite as noticeable as IÂ’d have liked. Medium body and minimal carbonation make this one very pleasing to the palate, but the taste is perhaps a bit blander than I was expecting.

The aroma is very complex; I was ready for that. It takes a few sniffs to get everything that is going on. Smells of oak, bourbon, light raisin, fig. Not as strong of a coffee aroma as one would expect. Dark chocolate undertones in the scent. Expensive dark chocolate, not artificial like in some beers. Some booze, not much. Black in color with a medium tan head. Leaves heavy lacing on the glass. Great looking stout. Taste is pleasant coffee, not overpowering. Hop bitterness comes through after the coffee. Flavor is not nearly as complex as the aroma. Surprisingly watery in texture - I was really expecting a richer palate. I can see why they say it goes well with breakfast. A stronger beer would be too much for the morning. Being that I never drink beer for breakfast, I really have no use for this. The palate is disappointing, itÂ’s very expensive and the flavor doesnÂ’t give you much besides coffee and hops. ItÂ’s not bad, but no way should it be 100 points. Perhaps I am biased because I like big, bold, rich stouts, and this is not one of those. For the price and reputation, I was expecting to be blown away. Right off the top of my head, I can think of 5 stouts I like better than this.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Clear, very dark, chestnut brown. Thin, lasting, tan coloured head. Dark, roast malt. Wood ash. Hint of cocoa. Hint of coffee. Taste is dry and very bitter. Palate is ashy dry and thick. Long lasting, bitter, slightly tart finish.

500 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black with a huge, creamy light brown head. Aroma is dominated by roasted malt and coffee. Slightly sweet flavour with roasted malt, oatmeal, dark chocolate and coffee. Full body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. With out a doubt the best stout in the world.

330ml bottle, pours black with a dark tan head. Aroma is deep roasted malt, rich coffee with bitter texture, hints of dark chocolate, smokiness, zesty citrus note running through. Finish is cocoa and bitter. Nicely complex with plenty of flavour. Very nice.

Beautiful black mocha color with a tan head that sticks. Strong coffee smell. Smooth coffee flavor with dark chocolate and a bit of sweet. Borders on an Imperial body, but maintains the stout consistency. Some smokiness and bitter cocoa. Great balance.
On tap. Pours black color, dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, hops, chocolate. Taste is bitter, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, roasted malt.

Pours black with a thick, creamy, cappuccino-colored head. Moderate lacing. Nose is dark-roasted grain, huge malt, notes of dark chocolate, burnt coffee, and oatmeal. A little woody note. Taste is sharply bitter and lasts long. Full-body, moderate carbonation. This is a burly beast.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Iron Abbey. Pours dark reddish black with thick tan head. Roast, coffee, toffee, cereal. Lightly bitter and sweet. Medium, creamy body.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 Bottles from The Beerhive and Bottle Baron. Black body with a medium tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of boozy cherry, creamy oats and black forest gateaux. Flavour of pistachio, bitter dark chocolate and filter coffee then the dark fruit notes come. Faint spice. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Faint carbonation. Well balanced and outrageously drinkable.
On tap at Kontynuacja, Wroclaw. On aroma - grain coffee. Taste: again coffee, oatmeal, long bitterness. Some sourness (as in coffee). Almost no sweetness, very dry.
0.33l bottle. Black body, thin brown head. Aroma and taste of chocolate, citrusy hops and coffee. Smooth medium body. Very nice but could be a bit heavier on the body.

Butelka. Piwo nalewa siÄ™ czarne z gÄ™stÄ…, drobniutkÄ… pianÄ…, ktÃ³ra Å‚adnie oblepia szkÅ‚o. W aromacie dominujÄ… palone sÅ‚ody, kawa ciemna czekolada. Smak jest bardzo bogaty. PalonoÅ›Ä‡, kawa, czekolada, dobra goryczka palona i chmielowa. Piwo jest gÅ‚adkie, a alkohol niewyczuwalny. Åšwietne.

33 cl bottle poured into a giant snifter. Pour is pitch black with a small tan head. Nose has loads of freshly ground coffee, some soy sauce, liquorice, dark chocolate and some ash. Taste has coffee, dark chocolates, tar, light vanilla and caramel. Beautifully balanced beer, finishes off with some light bitterness.

Dark brown, almost black and oily beer with mocha colored head. Aroma has salty and sweet licorice, roasted and loafy malts and dark coffee. Flavor is roasted, bitter and coffee acidic with some cocoa nibs dryness. Palate is quite full with soft carbonation and stinging bitterness. Finishes with long and quite heavy, dry grapefruity bitterness with some coffee acidicy. A stout with decent bitterness and well used coffee. Could use more sweetness and fullness
Bottle from Total Wine. Pours jet black with a chocolate colored head that dissipates quickly. Smells like roasted coffee. Tastes like coffee, coffee, and coffee. Fun to try, but not really for me.

From tap @3. ZÃ¡horÃ¡cky pivnÃ½ festival Prievaly 2014. Pours dark black liquid, small brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate and espresso. Taste: dark black chocolate, espresso, hops, roasted. Medium sweat, medium to heavy bitter, light sour. Excellent. Palate: soft carbonation, full body, long bitter and roasted aftertaste, dry finish. Overall: perfect full bodied stout, harmony between roastiness and bitterness.

Molt bona cervesa, bona presÃ¨ncia dÂ’escuma i molt aroma i gust a cafÃ¨.
Muy buena cerveza, buena presencia de espuma y mucho aroma y sabor a cafÃ©.

Tap at 2. Zahoracky pivny festival. Aroma coffee, roasted, fruity flowery hoppy. Pitch black, stable brown head. Finds a rare balance between hops and roast in flavour. Rich coffee roast, fruity flowery hops. Very tasty.

Butelka 33cl.
OCZY : piwo jest ciemniejsze od smoÅ‚y. Ma Å›redniej wielkoÅ›ci piane o kolorze brÄ…zowym.

Pours thick and very dark brown with small brown head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt and licorice. Flavour has intense coffee-bitterness, very roasted. Finish is a little rough.

Draught
Aroma-fruits,floral, coffee, 
Appearance-black, brown foam, cloudy, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect beer
Thick oaty beer. Taste of roughly roasted malt. Quite a bitter aftertaste, with a bit of coffee. Smooth mouthfeel. Very nice, a real good brew.
Poured deep, deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of roast malt, chocolate and coffee. Medium body, very smooth from the oats. Flavour is rich, a bit of the aroma, a bit ashtray.

Pour from 2013 bottle is jet black with medium creamy tan head.
Aroma is pleasant with a chocolate notes and pronounced coffee. Also piney hops, Also get a little vanilla. The taste is a big contrast from the aroma. Very bitter and kind of harsh at times, with burnt to ash malt that is pretty overpowering.
Palate is full bodied, creamy, with soft carbonation with a very powerful, bitter, acidic finish. Did not enjoy this one very much at all, and IÂ’m a fan of bitter beers.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep black color with a thin rim of creamy brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, light chocolate, coffee. Flavor is pure burnt malt bitterness. Medium body with a lingering burnt malt and coffee bitterness. Pretty solid beer.

Pours a black beer with a dark beige head. 
Smells chocolate and slightly burnt also has a hint of milk.
Tastes nice and burnt. Really lingering and balanced.

Keg @ Bierhaus, Galway [160414]
Pitch black, creamy tan head, good lacing
Aroma - rich deep dark malts, good quality coffee that is well integrated and not over intense, dark chocolate, some savoury malts, slight soy, complex
Taste as aroma, really well integrated coffee, nice coffee roast, very rich yummy dark malts, soft roasted malts, getting some slight zesty hops on side of tongue, no over roasted stuff in here, complex, tastes superb
Palate - Soft carb, medium to full body, not too bitter, not too sweet, so well balanced. Finish as main flavour, getting more of those zest hops in the tail with all the coffee, dark malts and chocolate
Overall - What a find in Galway. Should have had this before. Just a fantastic stout!

Bottle. Brewed at Lervig. Pours black with a small brown head. Lots of coffee in the aroma, some roasted notes. Taste is coffee, light bitter roasted, a bit one dimensional. Medium body, a bit thin finish.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 At Roundhouse. Pitch black-brown with fine light tan head and long legs. Smells of leather, smoke, plum, bit of dried fruit though much more smoky than acidic/fruity. Tastes hugely bitter and of smoke and coffee - really big taste but with a surprisingly thin body. Very big, very bitter and smoky. Would be better balanced with a little more thickness (+ some oatmeal?) in the palate.

From tap @ Bier CaB. Pours pitch black with a big, perfect, brown head. Aroma is sweet, coffee-mocha, caramel, very well balanced. Flavor is great with notes of coffee and chocolate. Light bitter and sweet, not at all watery as I would have expected from a stout but VERY, VERY drinkable, Coffee-mocha notes all over but perfectly balanced. Best stout? Hell yeah!
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with beige head. Coffee, roasted, dark chocolate aroma. Coffee and roasted taste, with some chocolate, slightly sweet. Full body. Creamy texture.
Keg @ Euston Tap. Complex roasted malts, with coffee, oats and dark chocolate notes.. well balanced and drinkable. Probably helped being a fresh keg too!

Pours black with a thin, mocha head. Mild sediment floating. Aroma has big notes of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. Taste has big notes of coffee with roasted malts, and chocolate. Medium body and carbonation. Creamy texture with a dry, espresso finish. Overall a great coffee stout. Lots of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. Awesome!

Must be a bad batch going around based on other reviews. This beer  tasted and smelled like an ash tray mixed with industrial chemicals, nobody was able to stomach more than a sip. Absolutely disgusting.
Draught. Pitch black pour with small brown head. Aroma has intense sweet malt and some liquorice. Fresh taste with lots of flavour. Very nice

Black as black can be, with a beautiful tan head. The smell of coffee caress your nose at once. Taste of licorice, heavy roasted barley, oat and coffee. Lot of good coffee, not the bitter stuff. The cascade and centennial hops is wellbalanced. Still one of my favourite stouts from Mikkeller.
magical concoction for sure. Complete roasty goodness, coffee, dark chocolate. Very nice

Black pour with bubbly tan head. Smells like roast malt and coffee with some earthiness. Taste is black licorice, roasted malt and tons of coffee. Really, tons of coffee. Quite dry but medium-heavy body - easier to drink than other big stouts.

Bottle (330 ml) at TrÃ¶ls. DidnÂ’t make a very lasting impression, strong hints of burndt malt, some (stale) coffee and chocolate. My guess is something went wrong with this batch/bottle or everybody is just out of their minds.
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 SomethingÂ’s wrong here. Heard nothing but great stuff about this beer and it tastes like itÂ’s made from liquified pennies. WTF!?!

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Medium brown head which fades quickly. Opaque black body, oil-like. Aroma is not surprisingly coffee, hay, bread, roasted malt and dark fruits. Quite sharp and heavy, although sweet in the nose. Sweet on the tongue at first with a bitter aftertaste. Quite full and rich without becoming too much.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Black with brown head, nose is roasted coffee but actually not too distinguished. Taste is full of roasted coffee and dark chocolate malts. Liqourice on the far back end of the tongue. Long and lasting bitterness and both light and creamy mouthfeel. Excellent stout, though I find the Mikkeller Texas Ranger more interesting. Retasted toddy at ÃƒÂƒÃ‹Âœrsted ÃƒÂƒÃ‹Âœlbar - on tap. Seemed quite a bit more smoked today and definitely more complex - but not necessarily to my liking.

How: Bottle.
Where: Nk Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Almost black colour with a small brown head.
Aroma: Coffee, roasted malt, chocolate.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, roasted malt, liquorice, coffee.

Pitch black in color, half finger tan head. Nose is coffee, bitter chocolate, licorice. Syrupy mouth feel. Intense burnt coffee/chocolate taste with a good level of bitterness, some roasted brown sugar and earthy smoke. Finishes fairly bitter and long.

Pitch black, dense tan head, great lace. Earthy coffee, dusty cocoa, brown sugar nose. Flavor is earthy coffee, raw dark chocolate bitterness, chocolate cake sweetness, and a touch of citric acidity. Velvet smooth, rounded oat-y texture and a relatively dry finish. Only problem with this is price.

Bottle 33 cl.
Pours completely black, with a nice creamy brown head. Impressive lacing. Aroma of malts and coffee. Oat and chocolate, if you search for it. Taste of coffee, some hoppy bitters, a touch of chocolate and oats. With a beautiful, well balanced bitter finish. The nose is a bit shy, otherwise this is quite close to perfection.

Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein schwarzes Bier mit schÃ¶ner brÃ¤unlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch rÃ¶stmalzig, Espresso, Schokolade. Geschmack sehr rÃ¶stmalzig, angenehm cremig, schokoladig, Kaffe. Wow, lecker!

330ml 7.5% Fantastic expresso coffee aroma. Pours medium bodied oil like with brown tar one finger head. Strong taste of coffee which evolves on the palate. A smooth chocolate taste lingers in the background. Slight carbonation on the tongue. There is a strong hoppy bitter tasfe which lingers for up to 5minutes. I possibly opened it too warm off the shelf. Very bitter and a very strong taste thst might go well with mature cheese or beef but not on itÂ’s own for me.

Bottle. Nice black body with brown head. Wonderful aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste is roasted malts caramel coffee cocoa. Aftertaste is chocolate coffee medium bitterness. Really a great one. Wonderful balanced.

Poured from a 330 mL bottle. Black with a brown head. Moderate lacing. Aroma is sweet dark malt, caramel, and expresso. Flavour is burnt malt, toffee, chocolate covered coffee beens, and light hops. Perfect beer for a 5 AM Olympic hockey gold medal game.
Bottle. Motor oil dark. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste of coffee with hints if oatmeal. Slight carbonation. Slight coffee aftertaste. Fantastic beer.
Long Time Coming with this brew. Big coffee flavor. Dry and lively with huge burnt coffee, malt, and slight dark chocolate. Full body throughout. Awesome brew.

500ml bottle at Bistro LÂ’Autre Oeil. Black pour with no head. Flavors are sweet oat, soy sauce, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, caramel, smoke, dark fruits, coffee, roasted malts and licorice. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, thin but creamy texture.
11.2 oz bottle pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Taste is coffee, chocolate and roast.

Bottle from Bierkompass. Creamy tar black color, with a decent beige-brown head.

Strong aromatic smell of coffee, espresso, a little aggressive but wrapped up well in roasted malt sweetness with hazelnut.

Coffee is defining my first impression of tasting this beer. I find it very interesting, that the coffee flavor is troughout evolving and changing on my palate from the beginning to the end, which gives the beer a decent complexity with a medium-body. Coffee goes very well along with chocolate, perfect mingling together, to one creamy opening, which developes more bitter and malty to the end. The aftertaste is enormous, lasts for minutes and even longer as the beer warms up. Carbonation is higher than expected, but supports this style of stout easily, not too present giving this a fresher note. Coffee flavor is really great in this beer, sugar and malts are in perfect balance and support it, without making the beer too sweet or distract from the coffee, the main attraction. The development through different stages on the palate without loosing focus on the coffee impresses me, and it stays for such long time. Even the late uprising bitterness seems to go along with a remarcable smoothness, which gives this beer a soft, oily, appreciable mouthfeel. Chocolate becomes very present at the end and adds a yummy sweet note to the overall bitterness. This beer tastes great!

This is going to be the first beer I have had with breakfast, but itÂ’s in the name, and who am I to argue? Pours black with a thick tan head, good retention. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, and notes of dark chocolate. Tastes semi sweet, with coffee and some oat and earthy flavors. Also a little bit of burnt chocolate. This beer delivers a punch to the palate, with a rich creamy texture (almost oily), medium carbonation, and a lasting bitter finish leaving traces of espresso. A very well made oatmeal stout, not my favorite, but up there.
Dark dark black, dark brown. Coffee, chockolate, vanilla in the aroma, not to intense. Cold coffee chockolate with intense burned aftertaste. Medium body. A nice one for coffee drinkers.

50cl bottle from 2d2dspuma online store. Lovely dark color with lovely brown head. Body is wonderfully soft and mild. Taste is medium bitter. Aroma is very balanced between coffee, roasted, chocolate some milk and banana. Awesome brew.
Worthy of its reputatiion,dark,roast grains with a hint of coffee. Smoky,chocolaty finish. Best of the best.

My bottle had the more interesting label with the French press coffee maker on it. As much as I was expecting to be wowed by this, I was really disappointed. The appearance was everything I hoped it would be, but the flavor was too much. In particular, there was a sharp bitterness that wasnÂ’t good...not sure if it was coffee grounds or something else. The coffee wasnÂ’t overly strong as a flavor, though, only its effect. Bottle.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Ã˜kern. Black color, ofwhite foam.
Roasted aromas, coffee, malt and some dried fruits; medium/high aromas intensity. Medium/full body & high complexity. Good bitterness, well balanced. Very enjoyable

BB 23.03.2018, 0,33L bottle. Pours dark brown with nice brown head. The head stays for a moment. Intense aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, oat, licorine notes. Flavor: oatmeal, coffee, dark chocolate bitterness, slight sourness. Finish is very long, dark chocolate and ash bitter. Overall: it is exactly what label promises - nice oatmeal stout with coffee.

Botella de 50 cl en Cimmeria. Febrero de 2013. IncreÃ­ble stout con numerosas notas de cafÃ©. Color negro intenso con espuma algo oscura no muy persistente. Cuerpo medio, menos amarga que su compaÃ±era Beer hop Breakfast, IncreÃ­ble cerveza imprescindible repetir para saborearla de nuevo.

Bottle from Bierkompass.de. Pitch black body, almost no red reflections, with a medium, creamy, fairly stable, brown head. Complex, deep aromas of roast, wood, dark chocolate, coffee, smoke, liquorice. The taste follows this seemlessly, many coffee and smoke notes and all other aromas that were in the nose in a perfect balance, also the hops are slightly present in the background. And what a mouthfeel! Perfect! Extremely creamy, full, just the right amount of carbonation and a complex, long, bitter, smoky, even slightly dry finish, that releases dark aromas and "dazes" your throat with a smokiness even after minutes. Wow, the ratings are true, never had another Stout that came close to this! Especially the palate is amazing!

Not a lot of sweetness, great coffee taste, oats taste of course. Coffee aroma but not huge. On the swallow you taste coffee, nuts, oats and an aftertaste of bitter chocolate/coffee that lingers. 

Good stout, just not enough sweetness for me. Needs just a little more sweetness, I think the 7.5 ABV needs to be closer to 9

Lucky enough to have the opportunity to but this guy consistently, almost take it for granted. Pours an oily and viscous black with no highlights to be seen in the dim lighting of this room. A fluffy off tan head compacts into a single finger of sense froth already lacing the glass. The nose is slightly metallic to start, roasting coffee, fresh and hot roll off the nose. The standard dark chocolate notes intermingle with a touch of smoke floating about. Extremely enticing, barely can withstand not drinking it. First taste brings dark chocolate and toasty oats. Reminds me of slightly burnt oatmeal and scorched brown sugar. It feels a little light on the palate which isnÂ’t to my preference, but itÂ’s only a shade shy from perfection for me. Drying out on cocoa powder, espresso and some spicy pepper, this beer is absolutely tantalizing. Something I can drink again and again and never get bored of.

Black with a thin milk-chocolate coloured head. Strong aroma of roast malt, chocolate, coffee, liquorice. Taste sweet with a strong sour and bitter finish, really well balanced. Oily texture, low carbonation, could be a little thicker? Really good beer.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 2016.01.26 - 1st Place - #CraftBeerFantasyLeague 2016 - Stouts 

Rating #880 - January 4, 2014 - Week 1 of #beerguychrisgeekbeer - a 52 week craftbeer project on instagram. Pours a thick black with a tan head. Nose is toasted malt, coffee grinds, woodsmoke. Taste is more of these flavours, solid bitterness from the roasted malt and hop character. Lots of coffee flavour and the thick mouthfeel expected of oatmeal stouts. Superbly balanced. Worthy.
Totally black stout. Really caramelly and coffeish. Strong and roasted taste, very bitter also..
12 oz. bottle. Wow. Everything one would expect from a world class beer. Big aromas of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste follows suit-big and complex. Dynamite.

Thick black pour from a 12oz bottle with a slight tan head. Burnt malt and coffee nose. Pretty bitter flavor, though the beer is still a bit cold. Slightly less harsh as it warms and more malt notes come through. ItÂ’s nice, but not special like many of the variants are.

Bottle shared with SuBarbare @ Home. Color: dark black beer with high plato and small carbonation and medium brown foam. Smell: malt domination with caramel and coffee notes. Taste: high viscosity with good malt and nice bitterness, caramel and black bread notes. Aftertaste: nice wet bitterness.
Pours an opaque black with one finger tan head with moderate to heavy lacing. Deep roasted flavor with espresso. Modest to moderate bitter up front. Full bodied. Long smooth finish.
A great beer. Pours black with a nice wee head. Aromas of coffee, nice full mouthfeel, but not too full and tastes of coffee and chocolate...

As powerful as any coffee stout can be, this one packs a punch. Big on malts, cold brew and some leather. Nice.,

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

New Lervig bottle with a French press on it. Combines two of my favorite things. Smokey coffee and chocolate brownie aroma. Dark brown to black pour. Bittersweet coffee flavor, strong aftertaste of cocoa and coffee grinds. Thick but smooth flowing body, paste finish per the aftertaste. One of the best coffee stouts, which is always done well in the Nordic regions.
a very good stout. Coffee and cocoa and some smoke. Prefer MikkellerÂ’s Beer Geek Vanilla Shake. Overall: 16/20.

Alot of stout.
Espresso first and foremost .. Smoke, and surprisingly hoppy, bitter.
Will buy again.
A superb stout. Blackish brown. Thick tan head. Cocoa, licorice, dark fruit, molasses.

This is good, solid, but back to back with Tool's Udder Means comes in second. Want something ... More. Roastiness? Sweetness? Dunno. Again solid just not superb. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Global brew. Pours an opaque dark brown with a thin light tan head. Aroma is coffee and melted butter. Taste is dry like a merlot with espresso and bitter cocoa notes. Very good indeed.
Mikeller i stout. La combinaciÃ³ havia de ser peefecte. Mokka i chocolata al nas, cafÃ¨ i regalesia en boca i lleugera amargor floral del llÃºpol al final sense estridencies. Perfecte.
Opaque black with a brown head. Smokey peat aroma. Flavor of roasted coffee, peat, and chocolate. Full body - bread like. Very good.

Wiecie, ja tak prywatnie nie lubiÄ™ kawy. A to piwo jest jak kÄ…piel w oceanie tego trunku. Nie ma od niej ucieczki. Od koloru po zapach i smak - wszÄ™dzie ona! Ale treÅ›Ä‡ tego piwa, ten zniewalajÄ…cy finisz... piwo, ktÃ³re zostanie w mojej pamiÄ™ci na zawsze. To, mimo Å¼e w nazwie po prostu stout, jest regularny RIS. Opis moÅ¼e maÅ‚o rzeczowy, jednak maÅ‚o mnie to obchodzi. Mam nadziejÄ™, Å¼e po prostu zmobilizuje do zakupienia tego majstersztyku.

on drafter in a taster. poured pretty much solid black with mocha colored head. the aroma was very nice. lots of roasted malts and coffee and chocolate and whiffs of peat. the flavor who unlike my companion i thought it was great. lots of roasted malts and coffee slight smokiness in the middle with the chocolate on the end. very good oatmeal stout.

I liked this beer, but it was just a tad bit too hoppy for me :(
